Content Information

Stream:Oracle_Linux_8_STIG
Profile:
Id:MAC-1_Classified
Digital Signature Status:NOT DIGITALLY SIGNED
Stream Installation Date:2023-06-06
Status:accepted (2023-03-06)
Title:Oracle Linux 8 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and the software is provided "AS IS" without warranty or guarantee of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to, the warranties of merchantability and of fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall the Government be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or other dealings in the software. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Front-Matter:This content stream was enhanced with OCIL manual questions derived from the STIG Manual by the NIWC SCC team.

SCAP Benchmark Version: 1.5

Release Info:Enhanced Content 1.5.3 Date: 2023-05-09, based on Release: 1.5 Benchmark Date: 27 Apr 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-248521 - OL 8 must be a vendor-supported release. - Pass
    • V-248524 - OL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: To provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards. - Fail
    • V-248537 - OL 8 operating systems booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user mode and maintenance. - Pass
    • V-248540 - OL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes. - Fail
    • V-248574 - YUM must be configured to prevent the installation of patches, service packs, device drivers, or OL 8 system components that have not been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization. - Pass
    • V-248575 - OL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization. - Fail
    • V-248597 - There must be no "shosts.equiv" files on the OL 8 operating system. - Pass
    • V-248598 - There must be no ".shosts" files on the OL 8 operating system. - Pass
    • V-248649 - Unattended or automatic logon via the OL 8 graphical user interface must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-248650 - OL 8 must not allow users to override SSH environment variables. - Fail
    • V-248714 - OL 8 must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords. - Pass
    • V-248715 - OL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file. - Fail
    • V-248716 - OL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the password-auth file. - Fail
    • V-248823 - OL 8 must not have the telnet-server package installed. - Pass
    • V-248827 - OL 8 must not have the rsh-server package installed. - Pass
    • V-248870 - The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence in OL 8 must be disabled if a graphical user interface is installed. - Pass
    • V-248873 - The Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server package must not be installed if not required for OL 8 operational support. - Pass
    • V-248874 - The root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the OL 8 system. - Pass
    • V-248903 - A File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package must not be installed unless mission essential on OL 8. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-248869 - The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence must be disabled on OL 8. - Not Checked
    • V-252650 - The OL 8 operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords. - Not Checked

Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    Automated Checks

    • V-248519 - The OL 8 audit package must be installed. - Fail
    • V-248520 - OL 8 audit records must contain information to establish what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events. - Fail
    • V-248527 - OL 8 must display a banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon. - Pass
    • V-248533 - OL 8 must encrypt all stored passwords with a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm. - Pass
    • V-248534 - OL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords. - Pass
    • V-248535 - The OL 8 shadow password suite must be configured to use a sufficient number of hashing rounds. - Fail
    • V-248541 - OL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into rescue mode. - Pass
    • V-248542 - OL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into emergency mode. - Pass
    • V-248543 - The OL 8 "pam_unix.so" module must be configured in the system-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication. - Pass
    • V-248544 - The OL 8 "pam_unix.so" module must be configured in the password-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication. - Pass
    • V-248545 - OL 8 must prevent system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication. - Pass
    • V-248546 - The krb5-workstation package must not be installed on OL 8. - Pass
    • V-248547 - The krb5-server package must not be installed on OL 8. - Pass
    • V-248552 - OL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminate after a period of inactivity. - Fail
    • V-248554 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must have mode 0640 or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-248555 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must be owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248556 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must be group-owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248557 - The OL 8 "/var/log" directory must have mode 0755 or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-248558 - The OL 8 "/var/log" directory must be owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248559 - The OL 8 "/var/log" directory must be group-owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248565 - The OL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved TLS encryption in the OpenSSL package. - Pass
    • V-248567 - OL 8 system commands must have mode 755 or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-248576 - OL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution. - Fail
    • V-248577 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on symlinks. - Pass
    • V-248578 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on hardlinks. - Pass
    • V-248581 - OL 8 must require users to provide a password for privilege escalation. - Fail
    • V-248582 - OL 8 must require users to reauthenticate for privilege escalation and changing roles. - Pass
    • V-248583 - OL 8 must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel. - Pass
    • V-248584 - OL 8 must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo". - Fail
    • V-248585 - OL 8 must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command. - Fail
    • V-248601 - The OL 8 SSH public host key files must have mode "0644" or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-248602 - The OL 8 SSH private host key files must have mode "0640" or less permissive. - Pass
    • V-248603 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files. - Fail
    • V-248605 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known host's authentication. - Fail
    • V-248606 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow Kerberos authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-248607 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow GSSAPI authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-248611 - OL 8 must use a separate file system for "/tmp". - Fail
    • V-248613 - OL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH. - Fail
    • V-248615 - OL 8 must have the rsyslog service enabled and active. - Pass
    • V-248617 - OL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on the /boot directory. - Fail
    • V-248619 - OL 8 must prevent special devices on non-root local partitions. - Fail
    • V-248624 - OL 8 file systems must not execute binary files that are imported via Network File System (NFS). - Pass
    • V-248625 - OL 8 file systems must not interpret character or block special devices that are imported via NFS. - Pass
    • V-248626 - OL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are imported via Network File System (NFS). - Pass
    • V-248629 - OL 8 must disable the "kernel.core_pattern". - Fail
    • V-248632 - OL 8 must disable storing core dumps. - Fail
    • V-248633 - OL 8 must disable core dump backtraces. - Fail
    • V-248644 - All OL 8 local interactive user accounts must be assigned a home directory upon creation. - Pass
    • V-248652 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Pass
    • V-248653 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Fail
    • V-248654 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Pass
    • V-248655 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must automatically lock an account when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Fail
    • V-248656 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must automatically lock an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Pass
    • V-248657 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must automatically lock an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Fail
    • V-248660 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must prevent system messages from being presented when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Pass
    • V-248661 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must prevent system messages from being presented when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Fail
    • V-248662 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must log user name information when unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Pass
    • V-248663 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must log user name information when unsuccessful logon attempts occur. - Fail
    • V-248664 - OL 8 systems below version 8.2 must include root when automatically locking an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Pass
    • V-248665 - OL 8 systems, versions 8.2 and above, must include root when automatically locking an account until the locked account is released by an administrator when three unsuccessful logon attempts occur during a 15-minute time period. - Fail
    • V-248674 - OL 8 must have the tmux package installed. - Fail
    • V-248675 - OL 8 must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures for command line sessions. - Fail
    • V-248676 - OL 8 must ensure session control is automatically started at shell initialization. - Fail
    • V-248686 - OL 8 must ensure the password complexity module is enabled in the password-auth file. - Pass
    • V-248690 - OL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters of the same character class be limited to four when passwords are changed. - Fail
    • V-248691 - OL 8 must require the maximum number of repeating characters be limited to three when passwords are changed. - Fail
    • V-248692 - OL 8 must require the change of at least four character classes when passwords are changed. - Fail
    • V-248694 - OL 8 passwords for new users or password changes must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in "/etc/shadow". - Fail
    • V-248695 - OL 8 passwords for new users or password changes must have a 24 hours/1 day minimum password lifetime restriction in "/etc/login.defs". - Fail
    • V-248696 - OL 8 user account passwords must have a 60-day maximum password lifetime restriction. - Fail
    • V-248697 - OL 8 user account passwords must be configured so that existing passwords are restricted to a 60-day maximum lifetime. - Fail
    • V-248699 - OL 8 passwords must have a minimum of 15 characters. - Fail
    • V-248700 - OL 8 passwords for new users must have a minimum of 15 characters. - Fail
    • V-248705 - The OL 8 lastlog command must have a mode of "0750" or less permissive. - Fail
    • V-248706 - The OL 8 lastlog command must be owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248707 - The OL 8 lastlog command must be group-owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248711 - OL 8 must prevent the use of dictionary words for passwords. - Fail
    • V-248712 - OL 8 must enforce a delay of at least four seconds between logon prompts following a failed logon attempt. - Fail
    • V-248718 - OL 8 must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon an SSH logon. - Fail
    • V-248719 - OL 8 default permissions must be defined in such a way that all authenticated users can read and modify only their own files. - Fail
    • V-248722 - The OL 8 audit system must be configured to audit the execution of privileged functions and prevent all software from executing at higher privilege levels than users executing the software. - Fail
    • V-248724 - The OL 8 System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) must be alerted of an audit processing failure event. - Fail
    • V-248726 - The OL 8 System must take appropriate action when an audit processing failure occurs. - Fail
    • V-248728 - The OL 8 audit system must take appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full. - Fail
    • V-248729 - The OL 8 audit system must audit local events. - Fail
    • V-248730 - OL 8 must label all offloaded audit logs before sending them to the central log server. - Fail
    • V-248731 - OL 8 must resolve audit information before writing to disk. - Fail
    • V-248732 - OL 8 audit logs must have a mode of "0600" or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248733 - OL 8 audit logs must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248734 - OL 8 audit logs must be group-owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248735 - The OL 8 audit log directory must be owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248736 - The OL 8 audit log directory must be group-owned by root to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248737 - The OL 8 audit log directory must have a mode of 0700 or less permissive to prevent unauthorized read access. - Fail
    • V-248738 - The OL 8 audit system must protect auditing rules from unauthorized change. - Fail
    • V-248739 - The OL 8 audit system must protect logon UIDs from unauthorized change. - Fail
    • V-248740 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/shadow". - Fail
    • V-248741 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/security/opasswd". - Fail
    • V-248742 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/passwd". - Fail
    • V-248743 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/gshadow". - Fail
    • V-248744 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/group". - Fail

    • V-248746 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/sudoers.d/". - Fail

    • V-248808 - OL 8 audit tools must be owned by root. - Pass
    • V-248809 - OL 8 audit tools must be group-owned by root. - Pass

    • V-248829 - OL 8 must not have the asynchronous transfer mode (ATM) kernel module installed if not required for operational support. - Fail

    • V-248831 - OL 8 must not have the stream control transmission protocol (SCTP) kernel module installed if not required for operational support. - Fail

    • V-248840 - A firewall must be installed on OL 8. - Pass
    • V-248841 - A firewall must be active on OL 8. - Fail
    • V-248843 - OL 8 Bluetooth must be disabled. - Fail

    • V-248857 - OL 8 must mount "/var/tmp" with the "nosuid" option. - Pass
    • V-248858 - OL 8 must mount "/var/tmp" with the "noexec" option. - Pass
    • V-248859 - The OL 8 "fapolicy" module must be installed. - Fail
    • V-248862 - OL 8 must have the USBGuard installed. - Fail
    • V-248867 - All OL 8 networked systems must have and implement SSH to protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted and received information, as well as information during preparation for transmission. - Pass
    • V-248868 - OL 8 must force a frequent session key renegotiation for SSH connections to the server. - Fail
    • V-248871 - OL 8 must disable the systemd Ctrl-Alt-Delete burst key sequence. - Fail
    • V-248875 - OL 8 must prevent IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted. - Fail
    • V-248876 - OL 8 must prevent IPv6 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted. - Fail
    • V-248877 - OL 8 must not send Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects. - Fail
    • V-248878 - OL 8 must not respond to Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address. - Fail
    • V-248879 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets. - Pass
    • V-248880 - OL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets. - Fail
    • V-248881 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets by default. - Fail
    • V-248882 - OL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets by default. - Fail
    • V-248883 - OL 8 must not enable IPv6 packet forwarding unless the system is a router. - Fail
    • V-248884 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces. - Fail
    • V-248885 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces by default. - Fail
    • V-248886 - OL 8 must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default. - Fail
    • V-248887 - OL 8 must ignore IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages. - Fail
    • V-248888 - OL 8 must ignore IPv6 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages. - Fail
    • V-248889 - OL 8 must disable access to the network "bpf" syscall from unprivileged processes. - Pass
    • V-248890 - OL 8 must restrict the use of "ptrace" to descendant processes. - Fail
    • V-248891 - OL 8 must restrict exposed kernel pointer addresses access. - Pass
    • V-248892 - OL 8 must disable the use of user namespaces. - Fail
    • V-248893 - OL 8 must use reverse path filtering on all IPv4 interfaces. - Pass
    • V-248894 - OL 8 must enable hardening for the Berkeley Packet Filter Just-in-time compiler. - Fail
    • V-248895 - OL 8 must be configured to prevent unrestricted mail relaying. - Pass
    • V-248900 - OL 8 remote X connections for interactive users must be disabled unless to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements. - Fail
    • V-248901 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must prevent remote hosts from connecting to the proxy display. - Fail
    • V-248902 - If the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server is required, the OL 8 TFTP daemon must be configured to operate in secure mode. - Pass
    • V-248904 - OL 8 must not have the "gssproxy" package installed if not required for operational support. - Pass
    • V-248905 - OL 8 must not have the "iprutils" package installed if not required for operational support. - Pass
    • V-248906 - OL 8 must not have the "tuned" package installed if not required for operational support. - Pass
    • V-252658 - OL 8 systems below version 8.4 must ensure the password complexity module in the system-auth file is configured for three retries or less. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-248523 - OL 8 vendor-packaged system security patches and updates must be installed and up to date. - Not Checked
    • V-248525 - All OL 8 local disk partitions must implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of all information that requires at-rest protection. - Not Checked
    • V-248526 - OL 8 must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before granting local or remote access to the system via an SSH logon. - Not Checked

    • V-248571 - OL 8 library files must be owned by root. - Not Checked
    • V-248572 - OL 8 library files must be group-owned by root. - Not Checked

    • V-248640 - All OL 8 local interactive user home directory files must have mode "0750" or less permissive. - Not Checked

    • V-252652 - OL 8 library directories must be owned by root. - Not Checked

    • V-252660 - OL 8 systems, version 8.4 and above, must ensure the password complexity module is configured for three retries or less. - Not Checked

    • V-248677 - OL 8 must prevent users from disabling session control mechanisms. - Pass

    • V-248688 - OL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one lowercase character be used. - Fail
    • V-248689 - OL 8 must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one numeric character be used. - Fail
    • V-248693 - OL 8 must require the change of at least 8 characters when passwords are changed. - Fail
    • V-248698 - OL 8 must be configured in the password-auth file to prohibit password reuse for a minimum of five generations. - Fail
    • V-248709 - All OL 8 passwords must contain at least one special character. - Fail
    • V-248821 - OL 8 must disable the chrony daemon from acting as a server. - Fail
    • V-248822 - OL 8 must disable network management of the chrony daemon. - Fail

Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    V-248521 - OL 8 must be a vendor-supported release.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248521r779129_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010000
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

    Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
    Fix Text:Upgrade to a supported version of the operating system.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:102
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010000 - OL 8 must be a vendor-supported release.
    Description:Configuring the operating system to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists verifies compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

    Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The OL 8 minor version is supported.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10200 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The OL 8 minor version is supported.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10200 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc'
    • filename must be equal to 'oracle-release'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*Oracle Linux Server release 8\.(\d+)\b'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10200 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/oracle-release'
    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'oracle-release'
    • pattern equals '^\s*Oracle Linux Server release 8\.(\d+)\b'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'Oracle Linux Server release 8.8'
    • line equals 'Oracle Linux Server release 8.8'
    • subexpression equals '8'

    V-248524 - OL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: To provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248524r877398_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010020
    Identities:CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    CCI-000877 (NIST SP 800-53: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53A: MA-4.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 c)
    CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8)
    CCI-002890 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (6); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (6))
    CCI-003123 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (6); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (6))
    Description: Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the federal government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

    OL 8 uses GRUB 2 as the default bootloader. Note that GRUB 2 command-line parameters are defined in the "kernelopts" variable of the "/boot/grub2/grubenv" file for all kernel boot entries. The command "fips-mode-setup" modifies the "kernelopts" variable, which in turn updates all kernel boot entries.

    The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users must also ensure the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000033-GPOS-00014, SRG-OS-000125-GPOS-00065, SRG-OS-000250-GPOS-00093, SRG-OS-000393-GPOS-00173, SRG-OS-000394-GPOS-00174, SRG-OS-000423-GPOS-00187 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement DoD-approved encryption by following the steps below:

    To enable strict FIPS compliance, the fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel boot parameters during system installation so key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place.

    Enable FIPS mode after installation (not strict FIPS compliant) with the following command:

    $ sudo fips-mode-setup --enable

    Reboot the system for the changes to take effect.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:104
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010020 - OL 8 must implement NIST FIPS-validated cryptography for the following: to provision digital signatures, to generate cryptographic hashes, and to protect data requiring data-at-rest protections in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.
    Description:Use of weak or untested encryption algorithms undermines the purposes of using encryption to protect data. The operating system must implement cryptographic modules adhering to the higher standards approved by the federal government since this provides assurance they have been tested and validated.

    OL 8 uses GRUB 2 as the default bootloader. Note that GRUB 2 command-line parameters are defined in the "kernelopts" variable of the "/boot/grub2/grubenv" file for all kernel boot entries. The command "fips-mode-setup" modifies the "kernelopts" variable, which in turn updates all kernel boot entries.

    The fips=1 kernel option needs to be added to the kernel command line during system installation so that key generation is done with FIPS-approved algorithms and continuous monitoring tests in place. Users must also ensure the system has plenty of entropy during the installation process by moving the mouse around, or if no mouse is available, ensuring that many keystrokes are typed. The recommended amount of keystrokes is 256 and more. Less than 256 keystrokes may generate a non-unique key.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (fips_enabled == 1)
      • false (/boot/grub2/grubenv:kernelopts contains fips=1)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10400 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:fips_enabled == 1
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10400 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(\d+)$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10400 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • filepath equals '/proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled'
    • path equals '/proc/sys/crypto'
    • filename equals 'fips_enabled'
    • pattern equals '^(\d+)$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals '0'
    • line equals '0'
    • subexpression equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    subexpression
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10401 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/boot/grub2/grubenv:kernelopts contains fips=1
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10401 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grubenv'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernelopts=[^#]*fips=(\d+)\b'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10400 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248537 - OL 8 operating systems booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user mode and maintenance.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248537r779177_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010140
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for OL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or modify the boot menu. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to require an encrypted grub bootloader password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the "/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/user.cfg" file.

    Generate an encrypted grub2 password for the grub superusers account with the following command:

    $ sudo grub2-setpassword
    Enter password:
    Confirm password:
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:110
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010140 - OL 8 operating systems booted with United Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) must require authentication upon booting into single-user mode and maintenance.
    Description:If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for OL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or modify the boot menu.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.)
        • false (/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/user.cfg:GRUB2_PASSWORD exists and has a PBKDF2/SHA512 password assigned.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg exists.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11000 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11000 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*set\s+superusers\s*=\s*"(\w+)"\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11000 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^\S+$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11001 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/user.cfg:GRUB2_PASSWORD exists and has a PBKDF2/SHA512 password assigned.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11001 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/user.cfg'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*GRUB2_PASSWORD=(\S+)\b'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11001 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^grub\.pbkdf2\.sha512'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1200 (file_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg exists.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1200 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248540 - OL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248540r779186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010150
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for OL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or modify the boot menu. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to require a grub bootloader password for the grub superusers account with the grub2-setpassword command, which creates/overwrites the "/boot/grub2/user.cfg" file.

    Generate an encrypted grub2 password for the grub superusers account with the following command:

    $ sudo grub2-setpassword
    Enter password:
    Confirm password:
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:111
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010150 - OL 8 operating systems booted with a BIOS must require authentication upon booting into single-user and maintenance modes.
    Description:If the system does not require valid authentication before it boots into single-user or maintenance mode, anyone who invokes single-user or maintenance mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. GRUB 2 is the default boot loader for OL 8 and is designed to require a password to boot into single-user mode or modify the boot menu.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.)
        • false (/boot/grub2/user.cfg:GRUB2_PASSWORD exists and has a PBKDF2/SHA512 password assigned.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • true (/boot/grub2/grub.cfg exists.)
    Tests:

    Result:true
    Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg:superusers exists and has a name.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*set\s+superusers\s*=\s*"(\w+)"\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    • path equals '/boot/grub2'
    • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
    • pattern equals '^\s*set\s+superusers\s*=\s*"(\w+)"\s*$'
    • instance equals '1'

    • line equals ' set superusers="root"'
    • subexpression equals 'root'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11101 (textfilecontent54_test)

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*GRUB2_PASSWORD=(\S+)\b'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11101 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^grub\.pbkdf2\.sha512'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1300 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/boot/grub2/grub.cfg exists.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1300 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/boot/grub2/grub.cfg'
    • path equals '/boot/grub2'
    • filename equals 'grub.cfg'
    • type equals 'regular'
    • group_id equals '0'
    • user_id equals '0'
    • a_time equals '1694658811'
    • c_time equals '1684939034'
    • m_time equals '1684939034'
    • size equals '6535'
    • suid equals '0'
    • sgid equals '0'
    • sticky equals '0'
    • uread equals '1'
    • uwrite equals '1'
    • uexec equals '0'
    • gread equals '0'
    • gwrite equals '0'
    • gexec equals '0'
    • oread equals '0'
    • owrite equals '0'
    • oexec equals '0'

    V-248574 - YUM must be configured to prevent the installation of patches, service packs, device drivers, or OL 8 system components that have not been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248574r877463_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010370
    Identities:CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved Certificate Authority (CA). false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to verify the signature of packages from a repository prior to install by setting the following option in the "/etc/yum.repos.d/[your_repo_name].repo" file:

    gpgcheck=1
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:132
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010370 - YUM must be configured to prevent the installation of patches, service packs, device drivers, or OL 8 system components that have not been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.
    Description:Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved Certificate Authority (CA).
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (/etc/yum.repos.d/*.repo: gpgcheck = 1.)

    V-248575 - OL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248575r877463_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010371
    Identities:CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved Certificate Authority (CA). false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to remove all software components after updated versions have been installed.

    Set the "localpkg_gpgcheck" option to "True" in the "/etc/dnf/dnf.conf" file:

    localpkg_gpgcheck=True
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:133
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010371 - OL 8 must prevent the installation of software, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components of local packages without verification they have been digitally signed using a certificate that is issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that is recognized and approved by the organization.
    Description:Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Accordingly, patches, service packs, device drivers, or operating system components must be signed with a certificate recognized and approved by the organization.

    Verifying the authenticity of the software prior to installation validates the integrity of the patch or upgrade received from a vendor. This verifies the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor. Self-signed certificates are disallowed by this requirement. The operating system should not have to verify the software again. This requirement does not mandate DoD certificates for this purpose; however, the certificate used to verify the software must be from an approved Certificate Authority (CA).
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/dnf/dnf.conf:localpkg_gpgcheck is set to True, 1 or yes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13300 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/dnf/dnf.conf:localpkg_gpgcheck is set to True, 1 or yes.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13300 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/dnf/dnf.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*localpkg_gpgcheck\s*=\s*(\w+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13300 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'True'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13301 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13302 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'yes'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248597 - There must be no "shosts.equiv" files on the OL 8 operating system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248597r779357_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010460
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The "shosts.equiv" files are used to configure host-based authentication for the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication. false
    Fix Text:Remove any found "shosts.equiv" files from the system.

    $ sudo rm /etc/ssh/shosts.equiv
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:147
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010460 - There must be no "shosts.equiv" files on the OL 8 operating system.
    Description:The "shosts.equiv" files are used to configure host-based authentication for the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (There must be no shosts.equiv files on the system.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14700 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:There must be no shosts.equiv files on the system.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14700 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • recurse = directories
      • recurse_direction = down
      • recurse_file_system = local
    • path must be equal to '/'
    • filename must be equal to 'shosts.equiv'

    V-248598 - There must be no ".shosts" files on the OL 8 operating system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248598r779360_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010470
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The ".shosts" files are used to configure host-based authentication for individual users or the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication. false
    Fix Text:Remove any found ".shosts" files from the system.

    $ sudo rm /[path]/[to]/[file]/.shosts

    Description:The ".shosts" files are used to configure host-based authentication for individual users or the system via SSH. Host-based authentication is not sufficient for preventing unauthorized access to the system, as it does not require interactive identification and authentication of a connection request, or for the use of two-factor authentication.

    V-248649 - Unattended or automatic logon via the OL 8 graphical user interface must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248649r877377_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010820
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not allow an unattended or automatic logon to the system via a graphical user interface.

    Add or edit the line for the "AutomaticLoginEnable" parameter in the [daemon] section of the "/etc/gdm/custom.conf" file to "false":

    [daemon]
    AutomaticLoginEnable=false
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:370
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010820 - Unattended or automatic logon via the OL 8 graphical user interface must not be allowed.
    Description:Failure to restrict system access to authenticated users negatively impacts operating system security.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (Gnome is installed) (negated)
      • false (AutomaticLoginEnable is set to false in [daemon] section of /etc/gdm/custom.conf.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1100 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Gnome is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1100 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'gnome-shell'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:37000 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:AutomaticLoginEnable is set to false in [daemon] section of /etc/gdm/custom.conf.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:37000 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/gdm/custom.conf'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[daemon\]\s+[#\s\w=]*^\s*AutomaticLoginEnable=(\w+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:37000 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'false'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248650 - OL 8 must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248650r877377_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010830
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: SSH environment options potentially allow users to bypass access restriction in some configurations. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to allow the SSH daemon to not allow unattended or automatic login to the system.

    Add or edit the following line in the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file:

    PermitUserEnvironment no

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:173
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010830 - OL 8 must not allow users to override SSH environment variables.
    Description:SSH environment options potentially allow users to bypass access restriction in some configurations.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitUserEnvironment is set to no)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:17300 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitUserEnvironment is set to no
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:17300 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '(?i)^\s*PermitUserEnvironment\s+(\S+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:17300 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'no'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:17301 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '"no"'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248714 - OL 8 must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248714r858582_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-020330
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
    Fix Text:Edit the following line in "etc/ssh/sshd_config" to prevent logons with empty passwords.

    PermitEmptyPasswords no

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:213
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-020330 - OL 8 must not allow accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
    Description:If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitEmptyPasswords is NOT set to yes)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:21300 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitEmptyPasswords is NOT set to yes
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:21300 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)PermitEmptyPasswords(?-i)\s+"?yes"?\b'
    • instance must be equal to '1'

    V-248715 - OL 8 must not allow blank or null passwords in the system-auth file.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248715r779711_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-020331
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
    Fix Text:Remove any instances of the "nullok" option in the "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" file to prevent logons with empty passwords.

    Note: Manual changes to the listed file may be overwritten by the "authselect" program.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416

    Result:false

    • filename equals 'system-auth'
    • pattern equals '\bnullok\b'
    • instance equals '2'
    • text equals 'nullok'
    • line equals 'nullok'
    • subexpression does not exist

    V-248823 - OL 8 must not have the telnet-server package installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248823r780035_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040000
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    Examples of non-essential capabilities include but are not limited to games, software packages, tools, and demonstration software not related to requirements or providing a wide array of functionality not required for every mission, but which cannot be disabled.

    Verify the operating system is configured to disable non-essential capabilities. The most secure way of ensuring a non-essential capability is disabled is to not have the capability installed.

    The telnet service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session.

    If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to disable non-essential capabilities by removing the telnet-server package from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove telnet-server
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:304
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-040000 - OL 8 must not have the telnet-server package installed.
    Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    Examples of non-essential capabilities include but are not limited to games, software packages, tools, and demonstration software not related to requirements or providing a wide array of functionality not required for every mission, but which cannot be disabled.

    Verify the operating system is configured to disable non-essential capabilities. The most secure way of ensuring a non-essential capability is disabled is to not have the capability installed.

    The telnet service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session.

    If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The telnet-server package is absent.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:30400 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The telnet-server package is absent.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:30400 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'telnet-server'

    V-248827 - OL 8 must not have the rsh-server package installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248827r780047_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040010
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    The rsh-server service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session and has very weak authentication.

    If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to disable non-essential capabilities by removing the rsh-server package from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove rsh-server
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:307
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-040010 - OL 8 must not have the rsh-server package installed.
    Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    Operating systems are capable of providing a wide variety of functions and services. Some of the functions and services, provided by default, may not be necessary to support essential organizational operations (e.g., key missions, functions).

    The rsh-server service provides an unencrypted remote access service that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session and has very weak authentication.

    If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The rsh-server package is absent.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:30700 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The rsh-server package is absent.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:30700 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'rsh-server'

    V-248870 - The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence in OL 8 must be disabled if a graphical user interface is installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248870r780176_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040171
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: A locally logged-on user, who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence when using a graphical user interface by creating or editing the "/etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-disable-CAD" file.

    Add the setting to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence for a graphical user interface:

    [org/gnome/settings-daemon/plugins/media-keys]
    logout=''

    Update the dconf settings:

    $ sudo dconf update
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:371
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-040171 - The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence in OL 8 must be disabled if a graphical user interface is installed.
    Description:A locally logged-on user, who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete, when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of availability of systems due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (Gnome is installed) (negated)
      • false (logout is set to '' in [org/gnome/settings-daemon/plugins/media-keys] section of /etc/dconf/db/local.d*.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1100 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Gnome is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1100 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'gnome-shell'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:37100 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:logout is set to '' in [org/gnome/settings-daemon/plugins/media-keys] section of /etc/dconf/db/local.d*.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:37100 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/local.d'
    • filename must match the pattern '.*'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[org/gnome/settings-daemon/plugins/media-keys\]\s+[^\[\]]*^\s*logout=(\S+)\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:37100 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to ''''
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248873 - The Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server package must not be installed if not required for OL 8 operational support.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248873r780185_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040190
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If TFTP is required for operational support (such as the transmission of router configurations) its use must be documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO), restricted to only authorized personnel, and have access control rules established. false
    Fix Text:Remove the TFTP package from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove tftp-server
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8

    Result:true

    Description:If TFTP is required for operational support (such as the transmission of router configurations) its use must be documented with the Information System Security Officer (ISSO), restricted to only authorized personnel, and have access control rules established.

      • true (The tftp-server package is absent.)

    V-248874 - The root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the OL 8 system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248874r780188_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040200
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account other than root also has a User Identifier (UID) of "0", it has root authority, giving that account unrestricted access to the entire operating system. Multiple accounts with a UID of "0" afford an opportunity for potential intruders to guess a password for a privileged account. false
    Fix Text:Change the UID of any account on the system, other than root, that has a UID of "0".

    If the account is associated with system commands or applications, change the UID to one greater than "0" but less than "1000". Otherwise, assign a UID of greater than "1000" that has not already been assigned.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:339
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-040200 - The root account must be the only account having unrestricted access to the OL 8 system.
    Description:If an account other than root also has a User Identifier (UID) of "0", it has root authority, giving that account unrestricted access to the entire operating system. Multiple accounts with a UID of "0" afford an opportunity for potential intruders to guess a password for a privileged account.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Only the root account has a UID of zero.)
