    V-248903 - A File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package must not be installed unless mission essential on OL 8.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248903r780275_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-040360
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The FTP service provides an unencrypted remote access that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session. If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. SSH or other encrypted file transfer methods must be used in place of this service. false
    Fix Text:Document the FTP server package with the ISSO as an operational requirement or remove it from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove vsftpd
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:364
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-040360 - A File Transfer Protocol (FTP) server package must not be installed unless mission essential on OL 8.
    Description:The FTP service provides an unencrypted remote access that does not provide for the confidentiality and integrity of user passwords or the remote session. If a privileged user were to log on using this service, the privileged user password could be compromised. SSH or other encrypted file transfer methods must be used in place of this service.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (No FTP server package is present.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:36400 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:No FTP server package is present.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:36400 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must match the pattern '^.*ftpd.*$'

    V-248869 - The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence must be disabled on OL 8.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248869r833246_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:OL08-00-040170
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: A locally logged-on user, who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of system availability due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence for the command line with the following commands:

    $ sudo systemctl disable ctrl-alt-del.target

    $ sudo systemctl mask ctrl-alt-del.target

    Created symlink /etc/systemd/system/ctrl-alt-del.target -> /dev/null

    Reload the daemon to take effect:

    $ sudo systemctl daemon-reload
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.ol8:questionnaire:6481
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The x86 Ctrl-Alt-Delete key sequence must be disabled on OL 8.
    Description:A locally logged-on user, who presses Ctrl-Alt-Delete when at the console, can reboot the system. If accidentally pressed, as could happen in the case of a mixed OS environment, this can create the risk of short-term loss of system availability due to unintentional reboot. In a graphical user environment, risk of unintentional reboot from the Ctrl-Alt-Delete sequence is reduced because the user will be prompted before any action is taken.false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-248869, SV-248869r833246, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-248869, SV-248869r833246, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.ol8:testaction:6481
    Question:Verify OL 8 is not configured to reboot the system when Ctrl-Alt-Delete is pressed with the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl status ctrl-alt-del.target | grep Loaded:

    Loaded: masked (Reason: Unit ctrl-alt-del.target is masked.)

    If the "ctrl-alt-del.target" Loaded: value is not set to "masked", this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-252650 - The OL 8 operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-252650r818746_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:OL08-00-010121
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments. false
    Fix Text:Configure all accounts on the system to have a password or lock the account with the following commands:

    Perform a password reset:
    $ sudo passwd [username]
    Lock an account:
    $ sudo passwd -l [username]
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Questionnaires:
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.ol8:questionnaire:7261
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The OL 8 operating system must not have accounts configured with blank or null passwords.
    Description:If an account has an empty password, anyone could log on and run commands with the privileges of that account. Accounts with empty passwords should never be used in operational environments.false
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-252650, SV-252650r818746, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-252650, SV-252650r818746, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.ol8:testaction:7261
    Question:Check the "/etc/shadow" file for blank passwords with the following command:

    $ sudo awk -F: '!$2 {print $1}' /etc/shadow

    If the command returns any results, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    CCI-001878 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-7 a)
    CCI-001879 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-7 a)
    CCI-001880 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-7 a)
    CCI-001881 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-7 b)
    CCI-001882 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-7 b)
    CCI-001889 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-8 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-8 b)
    CCI-001914 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 (3); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 (3))
    CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
    Description: Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

    Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

    Associating event types with detected events in OL 8 audit logs provides a means of investigating an attack, recognizing resource utilization or capacity thresholds, or identifying an improperly configured OL 8 system.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000038-GPOS-00016, SRG-OS-000039-GPOS-00017, SRG-OS-000040-GPOS-00018, SRG-OS-000041-GPOS-00019, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00021, SRG-OS-000051-GPOS-00024, SRG-OS-000054-GPOS-00025, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000122-GPOS-00063, SRG-OS-000254-GPOS-00095, SRG-OS-000255-GPOS-00096, SRG-OS-000337-GPOS-00129, SRG-OS-000348-GPOS-00136, SRG-OS-000349-GPOS-00137, SRG-OS-000350-GPOS-00138, SRG-OS-000351-GPOS-00139, SRG-OS-000352-GPOS-00140, SRG-OS-000353-GPOS-00141, SRG-OS-000354-GPOS-00142, SRG-OS-000358-GPOS-00145, SRG-OS-000365-GPOS-00152, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000475-GPOS-00220 false
    Fix Text:Configure the audit service to produce audit records containing the information needed to establish when (date and time) an event occurred.

    Install the audit service (if the audit service is not already installed) with the following command:

    $ sudo yum install audit

    Fix Text:Configure the audit service to produce audit records containing the information needed to establish when (date and time) an event occurred with the following commands:

    $ sudo systemctl start auditd.service

    Title:OL08-00-030181 - OL 8 audit records must contain information to establish what type of events occurred, the source of events, where events occurred, and the outcome of events.
    Description:Without establishing what type of events occurred and their source, location, and outcome, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events leading up to an outage or attack.

    Audit record content that may be necessary to satisfy this requirement includes, for example, time stamps, source and destination addresses, user/process identifiers, event descriptions, success/fail indications, filenames involved, and access control or flow control rules invoked.

    Associating event types with detected events in OL 8 audit logs provides a means of investigating an attack, recognizing resource utilization or capacity thresholds, or identifying an improperly configured OL 8 system.

    V-248527 - OL 8 must display a banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248527r779147_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010049
    Identities:CCI-000048 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 a)
    CCI-001384 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 c 1)
    CCI-001385 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 c 2)
    CCI-001386 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 c 2)
    CCI-001387 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 2; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 c 2)
    CCI-001388 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-8 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-8.2 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-8 c 3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-8 c 3)
    Description: Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

    System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000023-GPOS-00006, SRG-OS-000228-GPOS-00088 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to display a banner before granting access to the system.

    Note: If the system does not have a graphical user interface installed, this requirement is Not Applicable.

    Create a database to contain the system-wide graphical user logon settings (if it does not already exist) with the following command:

    $ sudo touch /etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message

    Add the following lines to the [org/gnome/login-screen] section of the "/etc/dconf/db/local.d/01-banner-message":

    [org/gnome/login-screen]

    banner-message-enable=true

    Run the following command to update the database:

    $ sudo dconf update
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:105
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010049 - OL 8 must display a banner before granting local or remote access to the system via a graphical user logon.
    Description:Display of a standardized and approved use notification before granting access to the operating system ensures privacy and security notification verbiage used is consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance.

    System use notifications are required only for access via logon interfaces with human users and are not required when such human interfaces do not exist.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/dconf/db/local.d/*/banner-message-enable is set to true)
      • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
        • false (Gnome is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10500 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/dconf/db/local.d/*/banner-message-enable is set to true
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10500 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/dconf/db/local.d'
    • filename must match the pattern '.*'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*banner-message-enable\s*=\s*(\w+)$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10500 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'true'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1100 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Gnome is installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1100 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'gnome-shell'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248533 - OL 8 must encrypt all stored passwords with a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248533r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010110
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised.

    Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to encrypt all stored passwords.

    Edit/modify the following line in the "/etc/login.defs" file and set "[ENCRYPT_METHOD]" to SHA512:

    ENCRYPT_METHOD SHA512
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:106
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010110 - OL 8 must encrypt all stored passwords with a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.
    Description:Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised.

    Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (/etc/login.defs:ENCRYPT_METHOD >= SHA512)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10600 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/etc/login.defs:ENCRYPT_METHOD >= SHA512
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10600 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ENCRYPT_METHOD\s+([^#\r\n]*)'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10600 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'SHA512'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/login.defs'
    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'login.defs'
    • pattern equals '^\s*ENCRYPT_METHOD\s+([^#\r\n]*)'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'ENCRYPT_METHOD SHA512'
    • line equals 'ENCRYPT_METHOD SHA512'
    • subexpression equals 'SHA512'

    V-248534 - OL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248534r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010120
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password.

    Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised. false
    Fix Text:Lock all interactive user accounts not using SHA-512 hashing until the passwords can be regenerated with SHA-512.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:107
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010120 - OL 8 must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all stored passwords.
    Description:The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password.

    Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (No active password hash in /etc/shadow has a prefix other than '$6'.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10700 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:No active password hash in /etc/shadow has a prefix other than '$6'.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10701 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • subexpression matches the pattern '^[!*]'
    Exclude Items If:
    • subexpression matches the pattern '^[$][6]'

    V-248535 - The OL 8 shadow password suite must be configured to use a sufficient number of hashing rounds.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248535r880546_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010130
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password. The system must use a sufficient number of hashing rounds to ensure the required level of entropy.

    Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to encrypt all stored passwords with a strong cryptographic hash.

    Edit/modify the following line in the "/etc/login.defs" file and set "SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS" to a value no lower than "5000":

    SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS 5000
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:108
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010130 - The OL 8 shadow password suite must be configured to use a sufficient number of hashing rounds.
    Description:The system must use a strong hashing algorithm to store the password. The system must use a sufficient number of hashing rounds to ensure the required level of entropy.

    Passwords need to be protected at all times, and encryption is the standard method for protecting passwords. If passwords are not encrypted, they can be plainly read (i.e., clear text) and easily compromised.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (/etc/login.defs:SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS >= 5000)
        • false (/etc/login.defs:SHA_CRYPT_MAX_ROUNDS >= 5000)
      • true (/etc/login.defs:SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS >= 5000 if it is set at all)
      • true (/etc/login.defs:SHA_CRYPT_MAX_ROUNDS >= 5000 if it is set at all)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10800 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/login.defs:SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS >= 5000
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:10800 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*SHA_CRYPT_MIN_ROUNDS\s+(\d*)'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10800 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5000'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:10801 (textfilecontent54_test)

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/login.defs'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*SHA_CRYPT_MAX_ROUNDS\s+(\d*)'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:10800 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '5000'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    V-248541 - OL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into rescue mode.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248541r779189_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010151
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid root authentication before it boots into emergency or rescue mode, anyone who invokes emergency or rescue mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to require authentication upon booting into rescue mode by adding the following line to the "/usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service" file:

    ExecStart=-/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sulogin-shell rescue
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:112
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010151 - OL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into rescue mode.
    Description:If the system does not require valid root authentication before it boots into emergency or rescue mode, anyone who invokes emergency or rescue mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (OL8 operating systems require authentication upon booting into rescue mode)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11200 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:OL8 operating systems require authentication upon booting into rescue mode
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11200 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
    • filename must be equal to 'rescue.service'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ExecStart=-\/usr\/lib\/systemd\/systemd-sulogin-shell\srescue$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/rescue.service'
    • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
    • filename equals 'rescue.service'
    • pattern equals '^\s*ExecStart=-\/usr\/lib\/systemd\/systemd-sulogin-shell\srescue$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'ExecStart=-/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sulogin-shell rescue'
    • line equals 'ExecStart=-/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sulogin-shell rescue'
    • subexpression does not exist

    V-248542 - OL 8 operating systems must require authentication upon booting into emergency mode.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248542r779192_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010152
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: If the system does not require valid root authentication before it boots into emergency or rescue mode, anyone who invokes emergency or rescue mode is granted privileged access to all files on the system. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system to require authentication upon booting into emergency mode by adding the following line to the "/usr/lib/systemd/system/emergency.service" file:

    ExecStart=-/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-sulogin-shell emergency

    • subexpression does not exist

    V-248543 - The OL 8 "pam_unix.so" module must be configured in the system-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248543r818608_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010159
    Identities:CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
    Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

    Edit/modify the following line in the "/etc/pam.d/system-auth" file to include the sha512 option for pam_unix.so:

    password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:114
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010159 - The OL 8 "pam_unix.so" module must be configured in the system-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.
    Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Check the file /etc/pam.d/system-auth to see if the password section for pam_unix.so sets the cryptographic hashing algorithm to sha512.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11400 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Check the file /etc/pam.d/system-auth to see if the password section for pam_unix.so sets the cryptographic hashing algorithm to sha512.
    Check Existence:One and only one collected item may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11400 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
    • filename must be equal to 'system-auth'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*password[ \t]+sufficient[ \t]+pam_unix\.so(?:[ \t]+|(?:[ \t][^#\r\f\n]+[ \t]))sha512(?:[ \t]|$)'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/system-auth'
    • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
    • filename equals 'system-auth'
    • pattern equals '^[ \t]*password[ \t]+sufficient[ \t]+pam_unix\.so(?:[ \t]+|(?:[ \t][^#\r\f\n]+[ \t]))sha512(?:[ \t]|$)'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 '
    • line equals 'password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512 '
    • subexpression does not exist

    V-248544 - The OL 8 "pam_unix.so" module must be configured in the password-auth file to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248544r818611_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010160
    Identities:CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
    Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.

    Edit/modify the following line in the "/etc/pam.d/password-auth" file to include the sha512 option for pam_unix.so:

    password sufficient pam_unix.so sha512
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Publisher:DISA

    Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system.

    • filename must be equal to 'password-auth'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^[ \t]*password[ \t]+sufficient[ \t]+pam_unix\.so(?:[ \t]+|(?:[ \t][^#\r\f\n]+[ \t]))sha512(?:[ \t]|$)'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/password-auth'
    • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
    • filename equals 'password-auth'

    V-248545 - OL 8 must prevent system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248545r779201_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010161
    Identities:CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
    Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    The key derivation function (KDF) in Kerberos is not FIPS compatible. Ensuring the system does not have any keytab files present prevents system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication. A keytab is a file containing pairs of Kerberos principals and encrypted keys.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to prevent system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication.

    Remove any files with the .keytab extension from the operating system.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:116
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010161 - OL 8 must prevent system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication.
    Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    The key derivation function (KDF) in Kerberos is not FIPS compatible. Ensuring the system does not have any keytab files present prevents system daemons from using Kerberos for authentication. A keytab is a file containing pairs of Kerberos principals and encrypted keys.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (/etc/*.keytab does not exist.)
      • false (krb5-server-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.)
      • false (krb5-workstation-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11600 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/etc/*.keytab does not exist.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11600 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc'
    • filename must match the pattern '\.keytab$'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11601 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:krb5-server-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11601 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-server'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11600 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', release must be greater than or equal to '18'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be equal to '1.17'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11601 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be greater than '1.17'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11602 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:krb5-workstation-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11602 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-workstation'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11600 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', release must be greater than or equal to '18'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be equal to '1.17'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11601 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be greater than '1.17'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248546 - The krb5-workstation package must not be installed on OL 8.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248546r779204_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010162
    Identities:CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
    Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    Currently, Kerberos does not use FIPS 140-2 cryptography.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system. false
    Fix Text:Document the krb5-workstation package with the ISSO as an operational requirement or remove it from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove krb5-workstation
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:117
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010162 - The krb5-workstation package must not be installed on OL 8.
    Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    Currently, Kerberos does not use FIPS 140-2 cryptography.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (package krb5-workstation is NOT installed)
      • false (package krb5-workstation-1.17-18 or newer is installed)
      • false (package krb5-server is installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11700 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:package krb5-workstation is NOT installed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11602 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-workstation'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11701 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package krb5-workstation-1.17-18 or newer is installed
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11602 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-workstation'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11600 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', release must be greater than or equal to '18'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be equal to '1.17'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11601 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be greater than '1.17'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11702 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:package krb5-server is installed
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11601 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-server'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248547 - The krb5-server package must not be installed on OL 8.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248547r779207_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010163
    Identities:CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-7)
    Description: Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    Currently, Kerberos does not use FIPS 140-2 cryptography.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system. false
    Fix Text:Document the krb5-server package with the ISSO as an operational requirement or remove it from the system with the following command:

    $ sudo yum remove krb5-server
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:118
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010163 - The krb5-server package must not be installed on OL 8.
    Description:Unapproved mechanisms that are used for authentication to the cryptographic module are not verified and therefore cannot be relied on to provide confidentiality or integrity, and DoD data may be compromised.

    OL 8 systems using encryption are required to use FIPS-compliant mechanisms for authenticating to cryptographic modules.

    Currently, Kerberos does not use FIPS 140-2 cryptography.

    FIPS 140-2 is the current standard for validating that mechanisms used to access cryptographic modules use authentication that meets DoD requirements. This allows for Security Levels 1, 2, 3, or 4 for use on a general-purpose computing system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • true (krb5-server is NOT installed.)
      • false (krb5-server-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11800 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:krb5-server is NOT installed.
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11601 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-server'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:11601 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:false
    Title:krb5-server-1.17-18.el8.x86_64 or newer is installed.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:11601 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'krb5-server'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11600 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', release must be greater than or equal to '18'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be equal to '1.17'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:11601 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be greater than '1.17'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248552 - OL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminate after a period of inactivity.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248552r860908_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010200
    Identities:CCI-000879 (NIST SP 800-53: MA-4 e; NIST SP 800-53A: MA-4.1 (vi); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 e)
    CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
    CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-12)
    Description: Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free resources committed by the managed network element.

    Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and deallocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

    OL 8 uses "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" for configurations of OpenSSH. Within the "sshd_config", the product of the values of "ClientAliveInterval" and "ClientAliveCountMax" are used to establish the inactivity threshold. The "ClientAliveInterval" is a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the client. The "ClientAliveCountMax" is the number of client alive messages that may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client. If this threshold is met, sshd will disconnect the client. For more information on these settings and others, refer to the sshd_config man pages.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000126-GPOS-00066, SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109 false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to automatically terminate all network connections associated with SSH traffic at the end of a session.

    Modify or append the following line in the "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file:

    ClientAliveCountMax 1

    In order for the changes to take effect, the SSH daemon must be restarted.

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8os:def:248552
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010200 - OL 8 must be configured so that all network connections associated with SSH traffic are terminate after a period of inactivity.
    Description:Terminating an idle SSH session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle SSH session will also free resources committed by the managed network element.

    Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and deallocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

    OL 8 uses "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" for configurations of OpenSSH. Within the "sshd_config", the product of the values of "ClientAliveInterval" and "ClientAliveCountMax" are used to establish the inactivity threshold. The "ClientAliveInterval" is a timeout interval in seconds after which if no data has been received from the client, sshd will send a message through the encrypted channel to request a response from the client. The "ClientAliveCountMax" is the number of client alive messages that may be sent without sshd receiving any messages back from the client. If this threshold is met, sshd will disconnect the client. For more information on these settings and others, refer to the sshd_config man pages.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000126-GPOS-00066, SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072, SRG-OS-000279-GPOS-00109
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:ClientAliveCountMax = 1)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:tst:23024400 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:ClientAliveCountMax = 1
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:obj:23024400 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)ClientAliveCountMax(?-i)\s+"?(\d+)"?\s*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ind:ste:20000003 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248554 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248554r779228_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010210
    Identities:CCI-001314 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 c; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 b)
    Description: Only authorized personnel should be aware of errors and the details of the errors. Error messages are an indicator of an organization's operational state or can identify the OL 8 system or platform. Additionally, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and operational information must not be revealed through error messages to unauthorized personnel or their designated representatives.

    The structure and content of error messages must be carefully considered by the organization and development team. The extent to which the information system is able to identify and handle error conditions is guided by organizational policy and operational requirements. false
    Fix Text:Change the permissions of the file "/var/log/messages" to "0640" by running the following command:

    $ sudo chmod 0640 /var/log/messages
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:121
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010210 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.
    Description:Only authorized personnel should be aware of errors and the details of the errors. Error messages are an indicator of an organization's operational state or can identify the OL 8 system or platform. Additionally, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and operational information must not be revealed through error messages to unauthorized personnel or their designated representatives.

    The structure and content of error messages must be carefully considered by the organization and development team. The extent to which the information system is able to identify and handle error conditions is guided by organizational policy and operational requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (/var/log/messages file has mode 0640 or less permissive)
    Tests:

    Result:true
    Title:/var/log/messages file has mode 0640 or less permissive
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:12100 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/var/log/messages'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:12100 (file_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', suid must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sgid must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sticky must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', uexec must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gwrite must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gexec must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oread must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', owrite must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oexec must be equal to 'false'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/var/log/messages'
    • path equals '/var/log'
    • filename equals 'messages'
    • type equals 'regular'
    • group_id equals '0'
    • user_id equals '0'
    • a_time equals '1684911925'
    • c_time equals '1694658464'
    • m_time equals '1694658464'
    • size equals '297241'
    • suid equals '0'
    • sgid equals '0'
    • sticky equals '0'
    • uread equals '1'
    • uwrite equals '1'
    • uexec equals '0'
    • gread equals '0'
    • gwrite equals '0'
    • gexec equals '0'
    • oread equals '0'
    • owrite equals '0'
    • oexec equals '0'

    V-248555 - The OL 8 "/var/log/messages" file must be owned by root.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248555r779231_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010220
    Identities:CCI-001314 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 c; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 b)

    V-248559 - The OL 8 "/var/log" directory must be group-owned by root.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248559r779243_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010260
    Identities:CCI-001314 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 c; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 b)
    Description: Only authorized personnel should be aware of errors and the details of the errors. Error messages are an indicator of an organization's operational state or can identify the OL 8 system or platform. Additionally, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and operational information must not be revealed through error messages to unauthorized personnel or their designated representatives.

    The structure and content of error messages must be carefully considered by the organization and development team. The extent to which the information system is able to identify and handle error conditions is guided by organizational policy and operational requirements. false
    Fix Text:Change the group of the directory "/var/log" to "root" by running the following command:

    $ sudo chgrp root /var/log
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:126
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010260 - The OL 8 "/var/log" directory must be group-owned by root.
    Description:Only authorized personnel should be aware of errors and the details of the errors. Error messages are an indicator of an organization's operational state or can identify the OL 8 system or platform. Additionally, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and operational information must not be revealed through error messages to unauthorized personnel or their designated representatives.

    The structure and content of error messages must be carefully considered by the organization and development team. The extent to which the information system is able to identify and handle error conditions is guided by organizational policy and operational requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (/var/log directory is group-owned by root.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:12600 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/var/log directory is group-owned by root.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:12400 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/var/log'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:12300 (file_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', group_id must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • filepath equals '/var/log'
    • path equals '/var/log'
    • filename equals ''
    • type equals 'directory'
    • group_id equals '0'
    • user_id equals '0'
    • a_time equals '1684939154'
    • c_time equals '1694618203'
    • m_time equals '1694618203'
    • size equals '4096'
    • suid equals '0'
    • sgid equals '0'
    • sticky equals '0'
    • uread equals '1'
    • uwrite equals '1'
    • uexec equals '1'
    • gread equals '1'
    • gwrite equals '0'
    • gexec equals '1'
    • oread equals '1'
    • owrite equals '0'
    • oexec equals '1'

    V-248565 - The OL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved TLS encryption in the OpenSSL package.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248565r877394_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010294
    Identities:CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    Description: Without cryptographic integrity protections, information can be altered by unauthorized users without detection.

    Remote access (e.g., RDP) is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

    Cryptographic mechanisms used for protecting the integrity of information include, for example, signed hash functions using asymmetric cryptography, enabling distribution of the public key to verify the hash information while maintaining the confidentiality of the secret key used to generate the hash.

    OL 8 incorporates system-wide crypto policies by default. The employed algorithms can be viewed in the "/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/openssl.config" file.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000250-GPOS-00093, SRG-OS-000393-GPOS-00173, SRG-OS-000394-GPOS-00174, SRG-OS-000125-GPOS-00065 false
    Fix Text:Configure the OL 8 OpenSSL library to use only DoD-approved TLS encryption by editing the following line in the "/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config" file:

    For versions prior to crypto-policies-20210617-1.gitc776d3e.el8.noarch:

    MinProtocol = TLSv1.2

    For version crypto-policies-20210617-1.gitc776d3e.el8.noarch and newer:
    TLS.MinProtocol = TLSv1.2
    DTLS.MinProtocol = DTLSv1.2

    A reboot is required for the changes to take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:128
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010294 - The OL 8 operating system must implement DoD-approved TLS encryption in the OpenSSL package.
    Description:Without cryptographic integrity protections, information can be altered by unauthorized users without detection.

    Remote access (e.g., RDP) is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

    Cryptographic mechanisms used for protecting the integrity of information include, for example, signed hash functions using asymmetric cryptography, enabling distribution of the public key to verify the hash information while maintaining the confidentiality of the secret key used to generate the hash.

    OL 8 incorporates system-wide crypto policies by default. The employed algorithms can be viewed in the "/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/openssl.config" file.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Package crypto-policies is version 20210617 or newer.) (negated)
        • false (/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config: MinProtocol = TLSv1.2 or newer.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Package crypto-policies is version 20210617 or newer.)
        • true (/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config: TLS.MinProtocol = TLSv1.2 or newer.)
        • true (/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config: DTLS.MinProtocol = DTLSv1.2 or newer.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:12800 (rpminfo_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Package crypto-policies is version 20210617 or newer.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:12800 (rpminfo_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'crypto-policies'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:12800 (rpminfo_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', version must be greater than or equal to '20210617'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • name equals 'crypto-policies'
    • arch equals 'noarch'
    • epoch equals '(none)'
    • release equals '1.gitece0092.el8'
    • version equals '20221215'
    • evr equals '0:20221215-1.gitece0092.el8'
    • signature_keyid equals '82562ea9ad986da3'
    • extended_name equals 'crypto-policies-(none):20221215-1.gitece0092.el8.noarch'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:12801 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config: MinProtocol = TLSv1.2 or newer.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:12801 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*MinProtocol\s*=\s*([\.\w]+)\s*(?:#.*)?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:12801 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'TLSv1.2'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:12802 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to 'TLSv1.3'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:12802 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensslcnf.config: TLS.MinProtocol = TLSv1.2 or newer.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:12802 (textfilecontent54_object)

    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    V-248567 - OL 8 system commands must have mode 755 or less permissive.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248567r818622_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010300
    Identities:CCI-001499 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-5 (6); NIST SP 800-53A: CM-5 (6).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (6); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-5 (6))
    Description: If OL 8 were to allow any user to make changes to software libraries, those changes might be implemented without undergoing the appropriate testing and approvals that are part of a robust change management process.

    This requirement applies to OL 8 with software libraries that are accessible and configurable, as in the case of interpreted languages. Software libraries also include privileged programs that execute with escalated privileges. Only qualified and authorized individuals must be allowed to obtain access to information system components for purposes of initiating changes, including upgrades and modifications. false
    Fix Text:Configure the system commands to be protected from unauthorized access.

    Run the following command, replacing "[FILE]" with any system command with a mode more permissive than "755".

    $ sudo chmod 755 [FILE]
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8os:def:248567
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010300 - OL 8 system commands must have mode 755 or less permissive.
    Description:If OL 8 were to allow any user to make changes to software libraries, those changes might be implemented without undergoing the appropriate testing and approvals that are part of a robust change management process.

    This requirement applies to OL 8 with software libraries that are accessible and configurable, as in the case of interpreted languages. Software libraries also include privileged programs that execute with escalated privileges. Only qualified and authorized individuals must be allowed to obtain access to information system components for purposes of initiating changes, including upgrades and modifications.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (System command files have mode 755 or less permissive)

    • size equals '232120'
