    V-248576 - OL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248576r877463_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010372
    Identities:CCI-001749 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (3))
    Description: Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Disabling "kexec_load" prevents an unsigned kernel image (that could be a windows kernel or modified vulnerable kernel) from being loaded. Kexec can be used to subvert the entire secureboot process and should be avoided at all costs, especially since it can load unsigned kernel images.

    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to disable kernel image loading.

    Add or edit the following line in a system configuration file in the "/etc/sysctl.d/" directory:

    kernel.kexec_load_disabled = 1

    Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

    Load settings from all system configuration files with the following command:

    $ sudo sysctl --system
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:134
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010372 - OL 8 must prevent the loading of a new kernel for later execution.
    Description:Changes to any software components can have significant effects on the overall security of the operating system. This requirement ensures the software has not been tampered with and that it has been provided by a trusted vendor.

    Disabling "kexec_load" prevents an unsigned kernel image (that could be a windows kernel or modified vulnerable kernel) from being loaded. Kexec can be used to subvert the entire secureboot process and should be avoided at all costs, especially since it can load unsigned kernel images.
    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in kernel is set to 1)
      • false (kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13400 (sysctl_test)
    Result:false
    Title:kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in kernel is set to 1
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13400 (sysctl_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'kernel.kexec_load_disabled'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13400 (sysctl_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • name equals 'kernel.kexec_load_disabled'
    • value equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    value
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13401 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:kernel.kexec_load_disabled setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13403 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13401 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248577 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on symlinks.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248577r860911_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010373
    Identities:CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    Description: DAC is based on the notion that individual users are "owners" of objects and therefore have discretion over who should be authorized to access the object and in which mode (e.g., read or write). Ownership is usually acquired as a consequence of creating the object or via specified ownership assignment. DAC allows the owner to determine who will have access to objects they control. An example of DAC includes user-controlled file permissions.

    When DAC policies are implemented, subjects are not constrained as to what actions they can take with information for which they have already been granted access. Thus, subjects that have been granted access to information are not prevented from passing (i.e., the subjects have the discretion to pass) the information to other subjects or objects. A subject that is constrained in its operation by Mandatory Access Control (MAC) policies is still able to operate under the less rigorous constraints of this requirement. Therefore, while MAC imposes constraints preventing a subject from passing information to another subject operating at a different sensitivity level, this requirement permits the subject to pass the information to any subject at the same sensitivity level. The policy is bounded by the information system boundary. Once the information is passed outside the control of the information system, additional means may be required to ensure the constraints remain in effect. While the older, more traditional definitions of DAC require identity-based access control, that limitation is not required for this use of DAC.

    By enabling the "fs.protected_symlinks" kernel parameter, symbolic links are permitted to be followed only when outside a sticky world-writable directory, or when the UID of the link and follower match, or when the directory owner matches the symlink's owner. Disallowing such symlinks helps mitigate vulnerabilities based on insecure file system accessed by privileged programs, avoiding an exploitation vector exploiting unsafe use of open() or creat().

    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to enable DAC on symlinks.

    Add or edit the following line in a system configuration file in the "/etc/sysctl.d/" directory:

    fs.protected_symlinks = 1

    Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

    Load settings from all system configuration files with the following command:

    $ sudo sysctl --system
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:135
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010373 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on symlinks.
    Description:DAC is based on the notion that individual users are "owners" of objects and therefore have discretion over who should be authorized to access the object and in which mode (e.g., read or write). Ownership is usually acquired as a consequence of creating the object or via specified ownership assignment. DAC allows the owner to determine who will have access to objects they control. An example of DAC includes user-controlled file permissions.

    When DAC policies are implemented, subjects are not constrained as to what actions they can take with information for which they have already been granted access. Thus, subjects that have been granted access to information are not prevented from passing (i.e., the subjects have the discretion to pass) the information to other subjects or objects. A subject that is constrained in its operation by Mandatory Access Control (MAC) policies is still able to operate under the less rigorous constraints of this requirement. Therefore, while MAC imposes constraints preventing a subject from passing information to another subject operating at a different sensitivity level, this requirement permits the subject to pass the information to any subject at the same sensitivity level. The policy is bounded by the information system boundary. Once the information is passed outside the control of the information system, additional means may be required to ensure the constraints remain in effect. While the older, more traditional definitions of DAC require identity-based access control, that limitation is not required for this use of DAC.

    By enabling the "fs.protected_symlinks" kernel parameter, symbolic links are permitted to be followed only when outside a sticky world-writable directory, or when the UID of the link and follower match, or when the directory owner matches the symlink's owner. Disallowing such symlinks helps mitigate vulnerabilities based on insecure file system accessed by privileged programs, avoiding an exploitation vector exploiting unsafe use of open() or creat().
    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (fs.protected_symlinks setting in kernel is set to 1)
      • true (fs.protected_symlinks setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13500 (sysctl_test)
    Result:true
    Title:fs.protected_symlinks setting in kernel is set to 1
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13500 (sysctl_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'fs.protected_symlinks'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13500 (sysctl_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • name equals 'fs.protected_symlinks'
    • value equals '1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13501 (textfilecontent54_test)

    • Collect any available items.

    • path equals '/lib/sysctl.d'
    • filename equals '50-default.conf'
    • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*fs\.protected_symlinks\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals '
      fs.protected_symlinks = 1
      '
    • line equals '
      fs.protected_symlinks = 1
      '
    • subexpression equals '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:

    • path equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
    • filename equals '50-default.conf'
    • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*fs\.protected_symlinks\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'

      fs.protected_symlinks = 1
      '
    • line equals '
      fs.protected_symlinks = 1
      '
    • subexpression equals '1'

    V-248578 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on hardlinks.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248578r860912_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010374
    Identities:CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    Description: DAC is based on the notion that individual users are "owners" of objects and therefore have discretion over who should be authorized to access the object and in which mode (e.g., read or write). Ownership is usually acquired as a consequence of creating the object or via specified ownership assignment. DAC allows the owner to determine who will have access to objects they control. An example of DAC includes user-controlled file permissions.

    When DAC policies are implemented, subjects are not constrained as to what actions they can take with information for which they have already been granted access. Thus, subjects that have been granted access to information are not prevented from passing (i.e., the subjects have the discretion to pass) the information to other subjects or objects. A subject that is constrained in its operation by Mandatory Access Control (MAC) policies is still able to operate under the less rigorous constraints of this requirement. Therefore, while MAC imposes constraints preventing a subject from passing information to another subject operating at a different sensitivity level, this requirement permits the subject to pass the information to any subject at the same sensitivity level. The policy is bounded by the information system boundary. Once the information is passed outside the control of the information system, additional means may be required to ensure the constraints remain in effect. While the older, more traditional definitions of DAC require identity-based access control, that limitation is not required for this use of DAC.

    By enabling the "fs.protected_hardlinks" kernel parameter, users can no longer create soft or hard links to files they do not own. Disallowing such hardlinks mitigate vulnerabilities based on insecure file system accessed by privileged programs, avoiding an exploitation vector exploiting unsafe use of open() or creat().

    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to enable DAC on hardlinks.

    Add or edit the following line in a system configuration file in the "/etc/sysctl.d/" directory:

    fs.protected_hardlinks = 1

    Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

    Load settings from all system configuration files with the following command:

    $ sudo sysctl --system
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:136
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010374 - OL 8 must enable kernel parameters to enforce Discretionary Access Control (DAC) on hardlinks.
    Description:DAC is based on the notion that individual users are "owners" of objects and therefore have discretion over who should be authorized to access the object and in which mode (e.g., read or write).     /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf

    /etc/sysctl.conf

    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'fs.protected_hardlinks'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:13600 (sysctl_state)

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

    • value equals '1'

      fs.protected_hardlinks = 1'

    V-248581 - OL 8 must require users to provide a password for privilege escalation.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248581r860915_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010380
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: Without reauthentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user reauthenticate.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
    Fix Text:Configure the operating system to require users to supply a password for privilege escalation.

    Check the configuration of the "/etc/sudoers" file with the following command:
    $ sudo visudo

    Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.

    Check the configuration of the /etc/sudoers.d/* files with the following command:
    $ sudo grep -ir nopasswd /etc/sudoers.d

    Remove any occurrences of "NOPASSWD" tags in the file.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:139
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010380 - OL 8 must require users to provide a password for privilege escalation.
    Description:Without reauthentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user reauthenticate.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('NOPASSWD' does not exist in /etc/sudoers)
      • false ('NOPASSWD' does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13900 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'NOPASSWD' does not exist in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13900 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*\s+NOPASSWD.*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:13901 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'NOPASSWD' does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:13901 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
    • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*\s+NOPASSWD.*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/sudoers.d/vagrant'
    • path equals '/etc/sudoers.d'
    • filename equals 'vagrant'
    • pattern equals '^(?!#).*\s+NOPASSWD.*$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals '%vagrant ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL'
    • line equals '%vagrant ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL'
    • subexpression does not exist
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248582 - OL 8 must require users to reauthenticate for privilege escalation and changing roles.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248582r880551_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010381
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: Without reauthentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user reauthenticate.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
    Fix Text:Remove any occurrence of "!authenticate" found in the "/etc/sudoers" file or files in the "/etc/sudoers.d" directory.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:

    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010381 - OL 8 must require users to reauthenticate for privilege escalation and changing roles.
    Description:Without reauthentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the user reauthenticate.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('!authenticate' does not exist in /etc/sudoers)
      • true ('!authenticate' does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14000 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'!authenticate' does not exist in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14000 (textfilecontent54_object)

    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*\s+!\s*authenticate.*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14001 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
    • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^(?!#).*\s+!\s*authenticate.*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

    V-248583 - OL 8 must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248583r779315_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010382
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The sudo command allows a user to execute programs with elevated (administrator) privileges. It prompts the user for their password and confirms your request to execute a command by checking a file, called sudoers. If the "sudoers" file is not configured correctly, any user defined on the system can initiate privileged actions on the target system. false
    Fix Text:Remove the following entries from the sudoers file:
    ALL ALL=(ALL) ALL
    ALL ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:141
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010382 - OL 8 must restrict privilege elevation to authorized personnel.
    Description:The sudo command allows a user to execute programs with elevated (administrator) privileges. It prompts the user for their password and confirms your request to execute a command by checking a file, called sudoers. If the "sudoers" file is not configured correctly, any user defined on the system can initiate privileged actions on the target system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (ALL does not exist /etc/sudoers)
      • true (ALL does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14100 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:ALL does not exist /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14100 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ALL\s+ALL\=\(ALL(?:|\:ALL)\)\s+ALL\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14101 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:ALL does not exist in /etc/sudoers.d
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14101 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • path must be equal to '/etc/sudoers.d'
    • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*ALL\s+ALL\=\(ALL(?:|\:ALL)\)\s+ALL\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'

    V-248584 - OL 8 must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248584r880554_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010383
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password.
    For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page. false
    Fix Text:Define the following in the Defaults section of the /etc/sudoers file or a configuration file in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory:
    Defaults !targetpw
    Defaults !rootpw
    Defaults !runaspw

    Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
    /etc/sudoers
    /etc/sudoers.d/
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:142
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010383 - OL 8 must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".
    Description:The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password.
    For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
      • false (Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
      • false (Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14200 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14206 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14201 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14207 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14202 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14208 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248585 - OL 8 must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248585r880557_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010384
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the organization requires the user to re-authenticate when using the "sudo" command.

    If the value is set to an integer less than 0, the user's time stamp will not expire and the user will not have to re-authenticate for privileged actions until the user's session is terminated.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00156, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00157, SRG-OS-000373-GPOS-00158 false
    Fix Text:Configure the "sudo" command to require re-authentication.

    Edit the /etc/sudoers file:
    $ sudo visudo

    Add or modify the following line:
    Defaults timestamp_timeout=[value]

    Note: The "[value]" must be a number that is greater than or equal to "0".

    Remove any duplicate or conflicting lines from /etc/sudoers and /etc/sudoers.d/ files.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:143
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010384 - OL 8 must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command.
    Description:Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

    When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the organization requires the user to re-authenticate when using the "sudo" command.

    If the value is set to an integer less than 0, the user's time stamp will not expire and the user will not have to re-authenticate for privileged actions until the user's session is terminated.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Defaults timestamp_timeout is configured in /etc/sudoers)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14300 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Defaults timestamp_timeout is configured in /etc/sudoers
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14302 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:14300 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248601 - The OL 8 SSH public host key files must have mode "0644" or less permissive.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248601r779369_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010480
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If a public host key file is modified by an unauthorized user, the SSH service may be compromised. false
    Fix Text:Change the mode of public host key files under "/etc/ssh" to "0644" with the following command:

    $ sudo chmod 0644 /etc/ssh/*key.pub

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:149
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010480 - The OL 8 SSH public host key files must have mode "0644" or less permissive.
    Description:If a public host key file is modified by an unauthorized user, the SSH service may be compromised.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The SUSE operating system SSH daemon public host key files have mode 0644 or less permissive)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:14900 (file_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The SUSE operating system SSH daemon public host key files have mode 0644 or less permissive
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:14900 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • behavior requirements:
      • recurse_direction = down
    • path must be equal to '/etc/ssh'
    • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.pub$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:14900 (file_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', suid must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sgid must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sticky must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', uexec must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gwrite must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', gexec must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', owrite must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', oexec must be equal to 'false'

    • uwrite equals '1'

    • gread equals '1'
    • gwrite equals '0'
    • gexec equals '0'
    • oread equals '1'
    • owrite equals '0'
    • oexec equals '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:

    V-248602 - The OL 8 SSH private host key files must have mode "0640" or less permissive.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248602r880541_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010490
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If an unauthorized user obtains the private SSH host key file, the host could be impersonated. false
    Fix Text:Configure the mode of SSH private host key files under "/etc/ssh" to "0640" with the following command:

    $ sudo chmod 0640 /etc/ssh/ssh_host*key

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416

    Result:true

    • owrite equals '0'
    • oexec equals '0'

    V-248603 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248603r858568_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010500
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user. false
    Fix Text:Configure SSH to perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.

    Uncomment the "StrictModes" keyword in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" and set the value to "yes":

    StrictModes yes

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:151
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010500 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must perform strict mode checking of home directory configuration files.
    Description:If other users have access to modify user-specific SSH configuration files, they may be able to log on to the system as another user.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:StrictModes == yes)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:15100 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:StrictModes == yes
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:15100 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)StrictModes(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:15100 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(yes|"yes")$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248605 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known host's authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248605r858572_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010520
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
    Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow authentication using known hosts authentication.

    Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "yes":

    IgnoreUserKnownHosts yes

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:153
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010520 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow authentication using known host's authentication.
    Description:Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:IgnoreUserKnownHosts == yes)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:15300 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:IgnoreUserKnownHosts == yes
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:15300 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)IgnoreUserKnownHosts(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:15300 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(yes|"yes")$'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248606 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow Kerberos authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248606r858574_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010521
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
    Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow Kerberos authentication.

    Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "no":

    KerberosAuthentication no

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service

    V-248607 - The OL 8 SSH daemon must not allow GSSAPI authentication, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248607r858576_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010522
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring this setting for the SSH daemon provides additional assurance that remote logon via SSH will require a password, even in the event of misconfiguration elsewhere. false
    Fix Text:Configure the SSH daemon to not allow GSSAPI authentication.

    Add the following line in "/etc/ssh/sshd_config", or uncomment the line and set the value to "no":

    GSSAPIAuthentication no

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium

    V-248611 - OL 8 must use a separate file system for "/tmp".

    Description: The use of separate file systems for different paths can protect the system from failures resulting from a file system becoming full or failing. false

    V-248613 - OL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248613r858578_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010550
    Identities:CCI-000770 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2 (5) (b); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2 (5).2 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (5))
    Description: Although the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system. false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to stop users from logging on remotely as the "root" user via SSH.

    Edit the appropriate "/etc/ssh/sshd_config" file to uncomment or add the line for the "PermitRootLogin" keyword and set its value to "no":

    PermitRootLogin no

    The SSH daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the SSH daemon, run the following command:

    $ sudo systemctl restart sshd.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:160
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010550 - OL 8 must not permit direct logons to the root account using remote access via SSH.
    Description:Although the communications channel may be encrypted, an additional layer of security is gained by extending the policy of not logging on directly as root. In addition, logging on with a user-specific account provides individual accountability of actions performed on the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitRootLogin == no)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16000 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/etc/ssh/sshd_config:PermitRootLogin == no
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16000 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16000 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^(no|"no")$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
    • path equals '/etc/ssh'
    • filename equals 'sshd_config'
    • pattern equals '^\s*(?i)PermitRootLogin(?-i)[ \t]+([\w\"]+)[\s]*(?:|(?:#.*))?$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'PermitRootLogin yes
      #StrictModes yes'
    • line equals 'PermitRootLogin yes
      #StrictModes yes'
    • subexpression equals 'yes'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    subexpression

    V-248615 - OL 8 must have the rsyslog service enabled and active.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248615r779411_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010561
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring OL 8 to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists ensures compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

    Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections. false
    Fix Text:Start and enable the rsyslog service with the following commands:

    $ sudo systemctl start rsyslog.service

    $ sudo systemctl enable rsyslog.service
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:162
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010561 - OL 8 must have the rsyslog service enabled and active.
    Description:Configuring OL 8 to implement organization-wide security implementation guides and security checklists ensures compliance with federal standards and establishes a common security baseline across the DoD that reflects the most restrictive security posture consistent with operational requirements.

    Configuration settings are the set of parameters that can be changed in hardware, software, or firmware components of the system that affect the security posture and/or functionality of the system. Security-related parameters are parameters impacting the security state of the system, including the parameters required to satisfy other security control requirements. Security-related parameters include, for example, registry settings; account, file, and directory permission settings; and settings for functions, ports, protocols, services, and remote connections.

    V-248617 - OL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on the /boot directory.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248617r779417_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010571
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The "nosuid" mount option causes the system not to execute "setuid" and "setgid" files with owner privileges. This option must be used for mounting any file system not containing approved "setuid" and "setguid" files. Executing files from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access. false
    Fix Text:Configure the "/etc/fstab" to use the "nosuid" option on the /boot directory.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:163
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010571 - OL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on the /boot directory.
    Description:The "nosuid" mount option causes the system not to execute "setuid" and "setgid" files with owner privileges. This option must be used for mounting any file system not containing approved "setuid" and "setguid" files. Executing files from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (If /boot is mounted, it is mounted with the nosuid option)
        • false (If /boot is configured in /etc/fstab, it is configured with the nosuid option)
      • false (/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg exists.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16300 (partition_test)
    Result:false
    Title:If /boot is mounted, it is mounted with the nosuid option
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16300 (partition_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • mount_point must be equal to '/boot'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16300 (partition_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', mount_options must be equal to 'nosuid'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • mount_point equals '/boot'
    • device equals '/dev/sda1'
    • uuid equals 'cd381ead-28c2-4659-951d-9ebe628871ca'
    • fs_type equals 'xfs'
    • mount_options equals 'rw'
    • mount_options equals 'relatime'
    • mount_options equals 'seclabel'
    • mount_options equals 'attr2'
    • mount_options equals 'inode64'
    • mount_options equals 'logbufs=8'
    • mount_options equals 'logbsize=32k'
    • mount_options equals 'noquota'
    • mount_options equals '4096'
    • total_space equals '259584'
    • space_used equals '27324'
    • space_left equals '232260'
    • space_left_for_unprivileged_users equals '232260'
    • block_size equals '4096'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    mount_options
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16301 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:If /boot is configured in /etc/fstab, it is configured with the nosuid option
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16301 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*[^#\s]+\s+/boot\s+\S+\s+(\S+)\s+\S+\s+\S+\s*$'
    • instance must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16301 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?:^nosuid$|^nosuid,|,nosuid$|,nosuid,)'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • filepath equals '/etc/fstab'
    • path equals '/etc'
    • filename equals 'fstab'
    • pattern equals '^\s*[^#\s]+\s+/boot\s+\S+\s+(\S+)\s+\S+\s+\S+\s*$'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals 'UUID=cd381ead-28c2-4659-951d-9ebe628871ca /boot xfs defaults 0 0'
    • line equals 'UUID=cd381ead-28c2-4659-951d-9ebe628871ca /boot xfs defaults 0 0'
    • subexpression equals 'defaults'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    subexpression
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1200 (file_test)
    Result:false
    Title:/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg exists.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1200 (file_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grub.cfg'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-248619 - OL 8 must prevent special devices on non-root local partitions.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248619r779423_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010580
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The "nodev" mount option causes the system to not interpret character or block special devices. Executing character or block special devices from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access. The only legitimate location for device files is the /dev directory located on the root partition. false
    Fix Text:Configure the "/etc/fstab" to use the "nodev" option on all non-root local partitions.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:164
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010580 - OL 8 must prevent special devices on non-root local partitions.
    Description:The "nodev" mount option causes the system to not interpret character or block special devices. Executing character or block special devices from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access. The only legitimate location for device files is the /dev directory located on the root partition.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Device files are mounted with the nodev option. Mounts on '/' are ignored.)
      • true (Device files are configured in /etc/fstab to use the nodev option. Mounts on '/' are ignored.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16400 (partition_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Device files are mounted with the nodev option. Mounts on '/' are ignored.
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16400 (partition_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • mount_point must match the pattern '^/\S+$'
    Include Items If:
    • device matches the pattern '^/dev\S*$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16400 (partition_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', mount_options must be equal to 'nodev'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • mount_point equals '/boot'
    • device equals '/dev/sda1'
    • uuid equals 'cd381ead-28c2-4659-951d-9ebe628871ca'
    • fs_type equals 'xfs'
    • mount_options equals 'rw'
    • mount_options equals 'relatime'
    • mount_options equals 'seclabel'
    • mount_options equals 'attr2'
    • mount_options equals 'inode64'
    • mount_options equals 'logbufs=8'
    • mount_options equals 'logbsize=32k'
    • mount_options equals 'noquota'
    • mount_options equals '4096'
    • total_space equals '259584'
    • space_used equals '27324'
    • space_left equals '232260'
    • space_left_for_unprivileged_users equals '232260'
    • block_size equals '4096'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    mount_options
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16401 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Device files are configured in /etc/fstab to use the nodev option. Mounts on '/' are ignored.
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16401 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*/dev\S*\s+/\S+\s+\S+\s+(\S+)\s+\S+\s+\S+\s*$'
    • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16401 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '(?:^nodev$|^nodev,|,nodev$|,nodev,)'

    V-248624 - OL 8 file systems must not execute binary files that are imported via Network File System (NFS).

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248624r779438_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:OL08-00-010630
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The "noexec" mount option causes the system not to execute binary files. This option must be used for mounting any file system not containing approved binary as they may be incompatible. Executing files from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access. false
    Fix Text:Configure the "/etc/fstab" to use the "noexec" option on file systems that are being imported via NFS.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:165
    Result:true
    Title:OL08-00-010630 - OL 8 file systems must not execute binary files that are imported via Network File System (NFS).
    Description:The "noexec" mount option causes the system not to execute binary files. This option must be used for mounting any file system not containing approved binary as they may be incompatible. Executing files from untrusted file systems increases the opportunity for unprivileged users to attain unauthorized administrative access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (all nfs entries in /etc/fstab have noexec)
      • true (all nfs entries in /etc/mtab have noexec)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16500 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:all nfs entries in /etc/fstab have noexec
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16500 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/fstab'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[?[\.\w:-]+\]?:[/\w-]+\s+[/\w-]+\s+nfs[4]?\s+(.*)$'
    • instance must not be equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16500 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^.*noexec.*$'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16501 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:true
    Title:all nfs entries in /etc/mtab have noexec
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16501 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • filepath must be equal to '/etc/mtab'
    • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*\[?[\.\w:-]+\]?:[/\w-]+\s+[/\w-]+\s+nfs[4]?\s+(.*)$'
    • instance must not be equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16500 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^.*noexec.*$'

    V-248626 - OL 8 must prevent files with the setuid and setgid bit set from being executed on file systems that are imported via Network File System (NFS).

    Result:Pass

    V-248629 - OL 8 must disable the "kernel.core_pattern".

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248629r858629_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:OL08-00-010671
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf false
    Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to disable storing core dumps by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

    kernel.core_pattern = |/bin/false

    Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

    The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

    $ sudo sysctl --system
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Oracle Linux 8
    Identifier:5416
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:168
    Result:false
    Title:OL08-00-010671 - OL 8 must disable the "kernel.core_pattern".
    Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.
    The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
    /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
    /etc/sysctl.conf
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel.core_pattern setting in kernel is set to '|/bin/false'.)
      • false (kernel.core_pattern setting in the sysctl configuration files is set to '|/bin/false', and nothing else)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16800 (sysctl_test)
    Result:false
    Title:kernel.core_pattern setting in kernel is set to '|/bin/false'.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16800 (sysctl_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • name must be equal to 'kernel.core_pattern'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16800 (sysctl_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^\|\s*/bin/false\s*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • name equals 'kernel.core_pattern'
    • value equals '|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    value
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:16801 (textfilecontent54_test)
    Result:false
    Title:kernel.core_pattern setting in the sysctl configuration files is set to '|/bin/false', and nothing else
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:16803 (textfilecontent54_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:16801 (textfilecontent54_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^\|\s*/bin/false\s*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • filepath equals '/lib/sysctl.d/50-coredump.conf'
    • path equals '/lib/sysctl.d'
    • filename equals '50-coredump.conf'
    • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*kernel\.core_pattern\s*=\s*(.+)'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals '.

      kernel.core_pattern=|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
    • line equals '.

      kernel.core_pattern=|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
    • subexpression equals '|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
    Collected Item/State Result:

    • filepath equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d/50-coredump.conf'
    • path equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
    • filename equals '50-coredump.conf'
    • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*kernel\.core_pattern\s*=\s*(.+)'
    • instance equals '1'
    • text equals '.

      kernel.core_pattern=|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
    • line equals '.

      kernel.core_pattern=|/usr/lib/systemd/systemd-coredump %P %u %g %s %t %c %h %e'
