                V-248740 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/shadow".

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248740r853796_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030130
                Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002132 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations events that affect "/etc/shadow".

                Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:232
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030130 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creation events that affect "/etc/shadow".
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit modifications to /etc/audit/audit.rules.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:23200 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit modifications to /etc/audit/audit.rules.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23200 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/shadow(?:\s+-p\s+(?:[rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-w\s+/etc/group(?:\s+-p\s+(?:[rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*))?(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248745 - OL 8 must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/sudoers".

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248745r853801_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030171
                Identities:CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002132 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/sudoers".

                Add or update the following file system rule to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k identity

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000304-GPOS-00121, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221

                Title:Audit modifications to /etc/sudoers.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23700 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'

                V-248747 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "su" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248747r853803_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030190
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "su" command allows a user to run commands with a substitute user and group ID.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to generate audit records for any use of the "su" command by adding or updating the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/su -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:239
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030190 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "su" command.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "su" command allows a user to run commands with a substitute user and group ID.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/su.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:23900 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/su.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:23900 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/su\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248748 - The OL 8 audit system must be configured to audit any use of the "setxattr", "fsetxattr", "lsetxattr", "removexattr", "fremovexattr", and "lremovexattr" system calls.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248748r853804_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030200
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
                "Setxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value.
                "Fsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a file.
                "Lsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a symbolic link.
                "Removexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes.
                "Fremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from a file.
                "Lremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from symbolic links.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. Performance can be helped, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219 false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "setxattr", "fsetxattr", "lsetxattr", "removexattr", "fremovexattr", and "lremovexattr" system calls by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod
                -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

                -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid=0 -k perm_mod
                -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid=0 -k perm_mod

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:240
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030200 - The OL 8 audit system must be configured to audit any use of the "setxattr", "fsetxattr", "lsetxattr", "removexattr", "fremovexattr", and "lremovexattr" system calls.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).
                "setxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value.
                "fsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a file.
                "lsetxattr" is a system call used to set an extended attribute value. This is used to set extended attributes on a symbolic link.
                "removexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes.
                "fremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from a file.
                "lremovexattr" is a system call that removes extended attributes. This is used for removal of extended attributes from symbolic links.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
                The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of setxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of setxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fsetxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fsetxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fsetxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fsetxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lsetxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lsetxattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lsetxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lsetxattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of removexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of removexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of removexattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of removexattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fremovexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fremovexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of fremovexattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of fremovexattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lremovexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lremovexattr system call by non-system users.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of lremovexattr system call by root user.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of lremovexattr system call by root user.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:24000 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of setxattr system call by non-system users.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:24000 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bsetxattr\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'

                V-248753 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "chage" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248753r853805_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030250
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chage" command is used to change or view user password expiry information.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "chage" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-chage

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:245
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030250 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "chage" command.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chage" command is used to change or view user password expiry information.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chage.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:24500 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chage.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:24500 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/chage\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248754 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any uses of the "chcon" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248754r853806_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030260
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chcon" command is used to change file SELinux security context.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "chcon" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chcon -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_chng

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:246
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030260 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any uses of the "chcon" command.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "chcon" command is used to change file SELinux security context.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chcon.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:24600 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/chcon.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:24600 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/chcon\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248756 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "ssh-agent" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248756r853807_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030280
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "ssh-agent" is a program to hold private keys used for public key authentication.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "ssh-agent" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/ssh-agent -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-ssh

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:248
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030280 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "ssh-agent" command.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "ssh-agent" is a program to hold private keys used for public key authentication.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/ssh-agent.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:24800 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/ssh-agent.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:24800 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/ssh-agent\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'

                V-248757 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "passwd" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248757r853808_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030290
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "passwd" command is used to change passwords for user accounts.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "passwd" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart

                V-248758 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "mount" command.

                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030300
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)

                V-248759 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "umount" command.

                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030301
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)

                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:251
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030301 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "umount" command.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" command is used to mount a filesystem.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/bin/umount.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25100 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/bin/umount.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25100 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/bin/umount\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248760 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "mount" syscall.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248760r853811_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030302
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" command is used to mount a filesystem.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "mount" syscall by adding or updating the following rules in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
                -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:252
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030302 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "mount" syscall.
                Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

                Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The "mount" command is used to mount a filesystem.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit 32-bit invocations of mount.)
                  • false (Audit 64-bit invocations of mount.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25200 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit 32-bit invocations of mount.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25200 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b32\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bmount\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25201 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit 64-bit invocations of mount.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25201 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)\s+-F\s+arch=b64\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-S\s+[,\w]*\bmount\b[,\w]*\s+(?:-S\s+[,\w]+\s+)*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248761 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "unix_update" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248761r853812_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030310
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. "Unix_update" is a helper program for the "pam_unix" module that updates the password for a given user. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line and logs a security violation in that event.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "unix_update" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/unix_update -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:253
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030310 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "unix_update" command.
                Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. "Unix_update" is a helper program for the "pam_unix" module that updates the password for a given user. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line and logs a security violation in that event.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/unix_update.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25300 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/unix_update.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25300 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/unix_update\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'

                V-248762 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "postdrop" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248762r853813_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030311
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postdrop" command creates a file in the maildrop directory and copies its standard input to the file.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "postdrop" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postdrop -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:254
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030311 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "postdrop" command.
                Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postdrop" command creates a file in the maildrop directory and copies its standard input to the file.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1".                   • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/postdrop.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25400 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/postdrop.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25400 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/postdrop\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'

                V-248763 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "postqueue" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248763r853814_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030312
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "postqueue" command implements the Postfix user interface for queue management.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure the audit system to generate an audit event for any use of the "postqueue" command by adding or updating the following rule in the "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules" file:

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/postqueue -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart

                V-248764 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "semanage" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248764r779858_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030313
                Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "semanage" command is used to configure certain elements of SELinux policy without requiring modification to or recompilation from policy sources.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way. false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "semanage" command by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:256
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030313 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "semanage" command.
                Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "semanage" command is used to configure certain elements of SELinux policy without requiring modification to or recompilation from policy sources.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/semanage.)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:25600 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:Audit invocations of /usr/sbin/semanage.
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:25600 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
                • for pattern, the following must be true:
                  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*-a\s+(?:always,exit|exit,always)(?:\s+-S\s+all)?\s+-F\s+path=/usr/sbin/semanage\s+(?:-F\s+perm=[rwa]*x[rwa]*\s+)?-F\s+auid>=1000\s+-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)(?:\s+(?:-k\s+|-F\s+key=)[-\w]+)*\s*$'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248765 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "setfiles" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248765r779861_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030314
                Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "setfiles" command is primarily used to initialize the security context fields (extended attributes) on one or more filesystems (or parts of them). Usually it is initially run as part of the SELinux installation process (a step commonly known as labeling).

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way. false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "setfiles" command by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/setfiles -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target

                Identifier:5416

                Result:false

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands.                 V-248766 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "userhelper" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248766r779864_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030315
                Identities:CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "userhelper" command is not intended to be run interactively. "Userhelper" provides a basic interface to change a user's password, gecos information, and shell. The main difference between this program and its traditional equivalents (passwd, chfn, chsh) is that prompts are written to standard out to make it easy for a graphical user interface wrapper to interface to it as a child process.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way. false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "userhelper" command by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/userhelper -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:258
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-030315 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "userhelper" command.
                Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "userhelper" command is not intended to be run interactively. "Userhelper" provides a basic interface to change a user's password, gecos information, and shell. The main difference between this program and its traditional equivalents (passwd, chfn, chsh) is that prompts are written to standard out to make it easy for a graphical user interface wrapper to interface to it as a child process.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1".                 V-248767 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "setsebool" command.

                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030316
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)

                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "setsebool" command sets the current state of a particular SELinux boolean or a list of booleans to a given value.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/setsebool -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart

                V-248768 - OL 8 must generate audit records for any use of the "unix_chkpwd" command.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248768r853816_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-030317
                Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
                CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
                CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 a)
                CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
                CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
                Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise. The "unix_chkpwd" command is a helper program for the pam_unix module that verifies the password of the current user. It also checks password and account expiration dates in shadow. It is not intended to be run directly from the command line and logs a security violation if done so.

                When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1". The AUID representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals "4294967295". The audit system interprets "-1", "4294967295", and "unset" in the same way.

                Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000062-GPOS-00031, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to audit the execution of the "unix_chkpwd" command by adding or updating the following lines to "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

                -a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/unix_chkpwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-unix-update

                The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect. To restart the audit daemon, run the following command:

                $ sudo service auditd restart

                At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The "unix_chkpwd" command is a helper program for the pam_unix module that verifies the password of the current user. It also checks password and account expiration dates in shadow.                 When a user logs on, the AUID is set to the UID of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to "-1".
