                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34103 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34101 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1400 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in kernel is set to 1
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1400 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:1400 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6'
                • value equals '0'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1401 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1403 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:1401 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1402 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1404 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/proc/cmdline'
                • pattern must match the pattern '\bipv6\.disable=1\b'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248877 - OL 8 must not send Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248877r858655_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040220
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). There is only a directive to disable sending of IPv4 redirected packets. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value, add or update the following line in "/etc/sysctl.conf" or in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:342
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040220 - OL 8 must not send Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.
                Description:ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). There is only a directive to disable sending of IPv4 redirected packets. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34200 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34200 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34200 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects'
                • value equals '1'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34201 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34203 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34201 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248878 - OL 8 must not respond to Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248878r858657_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040230
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Responding to broadcast ICMP echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). IPv6 does not implement the same method of broadcast as IPv4. Instead, IPv6 uses multicast addressing to the all-hosts multicast group. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not respond to IPv4 ICMP echoes sent to a broadcast address with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts=1

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "1" is not the system's default value, add or update the following line in "/etc/sysctl.conf" or in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts=1
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:343
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040230 - OL 8 must not respond to Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.
                Description:Responding to broadcast ICMP echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). IPv6 does not implement the same method of broadcast as IPv4. Instead, IPv6 uses multicast addressing to the all-hosts multicast group. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts setting in kernel is set to 1)
                  • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts setting in acceptable directory is set to 1, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34300 (sysctl_test)
                Result:true
                Title:net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts setting in kernel is set to 1
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34300 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34300 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ true ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts'
                • value equals '1'
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34301 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts setting in acceptable directory is set to 1, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34303 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34301 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248879 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248879r858659_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Pass
                Version:OL08-00-040239
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not forward IPv4 source-routed packets with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's all value then add or update the following line in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:344
                Result:true
                Title:OL08-00-040239 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets.
                Description:Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • true (All child checks must be true.)
                  • true (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route setting in kernel is set to 0)
                  • true (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)

                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ true ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route'
                • value equals '0'
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34401 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:true
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34403 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34401 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ true ]
                • filepath equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d/50-default.conf'
                • path equals '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
                • filename equals '50-default.conf'
                • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
                • instance equals '1'
                • text equals '
                  net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
                  '
                • line equals '
                  net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0
                  '
                • subexpression equals '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ true ]
                • filepath equals '/lib/sysctl.d/50-default.conf'
                • path equals '/lib/sysctl.d'
                • filename equals '50-default.conf'
                • pattern equals '(?:^|\.*\n)\s*net\.ipv4\.conf\.all\.accept_source_route\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'

                  net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

                V-248880 - OL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040240
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.

                V-248881 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets by default.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248881r858663_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040249
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not forward IPv4 source-routed packets by default with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value then add or update the following line in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:346
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040249 - OL 8 must not forward IPv4 source-routed packets by default.
                Description:Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in kernel is set to 0)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34600 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in kernel is set to 0
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34600 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34600 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route'
                • value equals '1'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:34601 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:34603 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34601 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248882 - OL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets by default.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248882r858665_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040250
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not forward IPv6 source-routed packets by default with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value then add or update the following line in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:347
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040250 - OL 8 must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets by default.
                Description:Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in kernel is set to 0)
                    • false (net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route setting in the sysctl configuration files is set to 0, and nothing else)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (All child checks must be true.)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in kernel is set to 1)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
                    • false (ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline)

                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:34701 (textfilecontent54_state)

                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1400 (sysctl_test)

                Result:false
                Title:ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1404 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/proc/cmdline'
                • pattern must match the pattern '\bipv6\.disable=1\b'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248883 - OL 8 must not enable IPv6 packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248883r858669_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040260
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not allow IPv6 packet forwarding unless the system is a router with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value, add or update the following lines in "/etc/sysctl.conf" or in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:348
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040260 - OL 8 must not enable IPv6 packet forwarding unless the system is a router.
                Description:Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (All child checks must be true.)
                    • true (net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding setting in kernel is set to 0)
                    • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding setting in /etc/sysctl.d/99-sysctl.conf is set to 0, and nothing else)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (All child checks must be true.)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in kernel is set to 1)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
                    • false (ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline)

                V-248884 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248884r858671_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040261
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.

                An illicit router advertisement message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces unless the system is a router with the following commands:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value, add or update the following lines in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:349
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040261 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces.
                Description:Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.

                An illicit router advertisement message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom.                     • false (All child checks must be true.)

                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1404 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/proc/cmdline'
                • pattern must match the pattern '\bipv6\.disable=1\b'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248885 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces by default.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248885r858673_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040262
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.

                An illicit router advertisement message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces by default, unless the system is a router, with the following commands:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value, add or update the following lines in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:350
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040262 - OL 8 must not accept router advertisements on all IPv6 interfaces by default.
                Description:Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network.

                An illicit router advertisement message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                  • false (All child checks must be true.)
                    • false (net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra setting in kernel is set to 0)
                    • false (net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra setting in the sysctl configuration files is set to 0, and nothing else)
                  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
                    • false (All child checks must be true.)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in kernel is set to 1)
                      • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else)
                    • false (ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35000 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra setting in kernel is set to 0
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35000 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35000 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra'
                • value equals '1'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35001 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_ra setting in the sysctl configuration files is set to 0, and nothing else
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35003 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35001 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1400 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in kernel is set to 1
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:1400 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6'
                • value equals '0'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1401 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 setting in sysctl configuration files is set to 1, and nothing else
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1403 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:1401 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:1402 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:ipv6.disable=1 in the kernel cmdline
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:Result is based on check existence only.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:1404 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • filepath must be equal to '/proc/cmdline'
                • pattern must match the pattern '\bipv6\.disable=1\b'
                • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248886 - OL 8 must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248886r858675_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040270
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). There is only a directive to disable sending of IPv4 redirected packets. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) ICMP redirects by default with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value, add or update the following line in "/etc/sysctl.conf" or in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects=0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:351
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040270 - OL 8 must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.
                Description:ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology.

                There are notable differences between Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) and Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6). There is only a directive to disable sending of IPv4 redirected packets. Refer to RFC4294 for an explanation of "IPv6 Node Requirements", which resulted in this difference between IPv4 and IPv6.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35100 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0
                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35100 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35100 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects'
                • value equals '1'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35101 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35103 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35101 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'
                Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

                V-248887 - OL 8 must ignore IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248887r858677_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040279
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure OL 8 to ignore IPv4 ICMP redirect messages with the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl -w net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects=0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                If "0" is not the system's default value then add or update the following line in the appropriate file under "/etc/sysctl.d":

                net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects = 0
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:352
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040279 - OL 8 must ignore IPv4 Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.
                Description:ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack.
                Class:compliance
                Tests:
                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects setting in kernel is set to 0)
                  • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files)
                Tests:
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35200 (sysctl_test)
                Result:false

                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35200 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35200 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects'
                • value equals '1'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35201 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects setting in acceptable directory is set to 0, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35203 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35201 (textfilecontent54_state)

                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '0'

                V-248889 - OL 8 must disable access to the network "bpf" syscall from unprivileged processes.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248889r858681_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Pass
                Version:OL08-00-040281
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to prevent privilege escalation through the kernel by disabling access to the "bpf" syscall by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

                kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled = 1

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl --system
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416

                Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives.                 V-248890 - OL 8 must restrict the use of "ptrace" to descendant processes.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248890r858683_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040282
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to restrict the use of "ptrace" to descendant processes by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

                kernel.yama.ptrace_scope = 1

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl --system
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8

                V-248891 - OL 8 must restrict exposed kernel pointer addresses access.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248891r858685_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Pass
                Version:OL08-00-040283
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to restrict exposed kernel pointer addresses access by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

                kernel.kptr_restrict = 1

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl --system

                Weight:10.0

                V-248892 - OL 8 must disable the use of user namespaces.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248892r858687_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Fail
                Version:OL08-00-040284
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                User namespaces are used primarily for Linux container. The value 0 disallows the use of user namespaces. When containers are not in use, namespaces should be disallowed. When containers are deployed on a system, the value should be set to a large non-zero value. The default value is 39078.

                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to disable the use of user namespaces by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

                user.max_user_namespaces = 0

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl --system
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:357
                Result:false
                Title:OL08-00-040284 - OL 8 must disable the use of user namespaces.
                Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                User namespaces are used primarily for Linux container. The value 0 disallows the use of user namespaces. When containers are not in use, namespaces should be disallowed. When containers are deployed on a system, the value should be set to a large non-zero value. The default value is 39078.
                Class:compliance

                • false (All child checks must be true.)
                  • false (user.max_user_namespaces setting in kernel is set to 0)

                Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35700 (sysctl_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • name must be equal to 'user.max_user_namespaces'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35700 (sysctl_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
                Collected Item/State Result:
                [ false ]
                • name equals 'user.max_user_namespaces'
                • value equals '7587'
                Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
                value
                Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:tst:35701 (textfilecontent54_test)
                Result:false
                Title:user.max_user_namespaces setting is set to 0 in acceptable directory, and nothing else, and there are no conflicting settings in other files
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

                V-248893 - OL 8 must use reverse path filtering on all IPv4 interfaces.

                Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-248893r858689_rule
                Test Type:Automated
                Result:Pass
                Version:OL08-00-040285
                Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
                Description: It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                Enabling reverse path filtering drops packets with source addresses that are not routable. There is no equivalent filter for IPv6 traffic.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files. All configuration files are sorted by their filename in lexicographic order, regardless of which of the directories they reside in. If multiple files specify the same option, the entry in the file with the lexicographically latest name will take precedence. Files are read from directories in the following list from top to bottom. Once a file of a given filename is loaded, any file of the same name in subsequent directories is ignored.
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf false
                Fix Text:Configure the system to use reverse path filtering on all IPv4 interfaces by adding the following line to a file in the "/etc/sysctl.d" directory:

                net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 1

                Remove any configurations that conflict with the above from the following locations:
                /run/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/local/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf
                /etc/sysctl.conf
                /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf

                The system configuration files must be reloaded for the changes to take effect. To reload the contents of the files, run the following command:

                $ sudo sysctl --system
                Severity:medium
                Weight:10.0
                Reference:
                Title:DPMS Target Oracle Linux 8
                Publisher:DISA
                Type:DPMS Target
                Subject:Oracle Linux 8
                Identifier:5416
                Definitions:
                Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:def:358
                Result:true
                Title:OL08-00-040285 - OL 8 must use reverse path filtering on all IPv4 interfaces.
                Description:It is detrimental for operating systems to provide, or install by default, functionality exceeding requirements or mission objectives. These unnecessary capabilities or services are often overlooked and therefore may remain unsecured. They increase the risk to the platform by providing additional attack vectors.

                Enabling reverse path filtering drops packets with source addresses that are not routable. There is no equivalent filter for IPv6 traffic.
                The sysctl --system command will load settings from all system configuration files.                 Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.

                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

                Result:true
                Title:net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter setting in in the sysctl configuration files is set to 1 or 2, and nothing else
                Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
                Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
                State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
                Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:obj:35803 (textfilecontent54_object)
                Object Requirements:
                • Collect any available items.
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35802 (textfilecontent54_state)
                State Requirements:
                • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '1'
                State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.ol8:ste:35803 (textfilecontent54_state)
